loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
"Pictured above is Esther, often described as an extremely reliable person. She is 30 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  She is married and has 4 children.

Esther is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Esther says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2014, she has been able to save more money, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Esther will use the profits from this season to send her children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.75 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 5 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 32 years old. He is married with four children aged between 2 and 8 years old. One of them goes to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 11 years. His wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice.

loans.name: Mwanahawa's Group

texts.en:
"Mwanahawa, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 4 children.

With a portion of this loan, Mwanahawa will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Mwanahawa plans to use the profits she gains this year to buy a cow.

In total Mwanahawa’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 7 solar lights."

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Ndumbini S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Regina. She is fifty nine years old, married and a mother of three children. One of her children is currently attending school. She is a member of Ndumbini SHG that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 to benefit from trainings, especially enterprise development training.

She grows maize and beans for sale to earn a living. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy hybrid certified seeds that will enable her increase her production and in the future earn more income and also ensure food security in her community.

Regina is happy for Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy hybrid certified seeds that will enable her increase her production.

loans.name: Glorious

texts.en:
Glorious is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past six years, Glorious has been working hard to manage her stationery shop, which sells stationery items. 

To help expand her business, Glorious has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy another photocopying machine, and will help Glorious to generate greater profits and increase family income. Glorious hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: buy another photocopying machine

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Brian has been working hard to manage his garments, selling men's clothes. 

To help expand his business, Brian has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy clothes, and will help Brian to generate greater profits and increase income. Brian hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is 39 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, Robinah has been working hard to manage her garments, selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Robinah has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bedsheets and skirts, and will help Robinah to generate greater profits and increase stock. Robinah hopes that in the future she will be able to cater for her family's well-being.

loans.use: buy bedsheets and skirts

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 41 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her garments business, selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX), from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and expand the business. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to increase the income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Janiffer

texts.en:
Janiffer is 48 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Janiffer has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household items. 

To help expand her business, Janiffer has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more books, pens, toilet paper, detergent, and oils, and will help Janiffer to generate greater profits and expand the business. Janiffer hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy more books, pens, toilet paper, detergent, oils

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 40 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Fred has been working hard to manage his garments business, selling women's suits, jeans, and t-shirts. 

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes, and will help Fred to generate greater profits and add stock. Fred hopes that in the future he will be able to increase profits.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Manana Junior Group

texts.es:
Natividad es una mujer de 38 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones de 12 y 16 años y una hija mujer de 7 años, y trabaja como modista.
Ella es buena madre, comprensiva, solidaria emprendedora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de Sacaba; área rural caracterizada por el crecimiento productivo y por su potencial comercial, situado en un valle semi-tropical, dónde la elaboración de comida es abundante y variada,  todo se acompaña con chicha (bebida fermentada de maíz). De clima templado durante todo el año; con una temperatura que varía entre 10-24 grados centígrados.
Natividad es de tez morena, baja estatura, ojos obscuros, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por comercio que realiza (sentada al centro, viste un chaleco negro y luce una cadena en el cuello). Su vida la realiza junto a sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y cuenta con los servicios de energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. La necesidad de ampliar su negocio para generar mejores ingresos económicos y pagar los gastos de su familia la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de masitas, confección de tejidos, librería, venta de jugos y farmacia,  para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la confección de ropa de moda, como; faldas, pantalones, blusas, vestidos y toda prenda de vestir que sea a la moda. “inicie mi negocio, confeccionando unas prendas de moda para niña, eso me trajo clientes y así continúe con mi actividad…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los clientes la conocen por su fama de ‘modista’, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la compra de materiales de modita como; telas, hilos, botones, cierres, etc. Su sueño es tener su propia empresa de confecciones de moda, ella desea realizar la compra de variedades de telas para confeccionar ropa de niña y otros accesorios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad de manera continua.
Es por esos motivos que Natividad solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de telas para confeccionar ropa de niña y pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Natividad, 38, is single and has two sons, 12 and 16, and a daughter, 7.  She works as a dressmaker.
She is a good mother, compassionate, solidary, enterprising, responsible, and very hard-working.  She works in the locality of Sacaba, a rural area characterized by productive growth and its commercial potential.  It is situated in a semi-tropical valley where the making of food is abundant and diverse.  Everything is accompanied with chicha (a fermented drink made from corn).  The climate is temperate all year with a temperature between 10 and 24 degrees Celsius.
Natividad is dark-complected; of short stature; with brown eyes and long, black hair tied back in a ponytail; of medium build; and whose native tongue is Quechua which she speaks in her local and she speaks Spanish in the general public and in the work she does (she is seated in the center wearing a black vest and a chain around her neck).  She lives her life with her children who are studying in school.  They live in their own house constructed of adobe with a corrugated zinc roof and which has electricity and well water.  
The necessity to expand her business to generate better income and pay the expenses of her family causes her to form a bank of people with businesses such as food sales, clothing sales, cake sales, weaving, a bookstore, juice sales, and a pharmacy in order to request a loan and improve their activities.  Her business is the creation of stylish clothing such as skirts, pants, blouses, dresses, and all articles of fashion clothing.  She says," I started my business making fashionable clothing for girls which brought me customers and thus I continue with my work."  The advantage of her work is that the customers know her because of her fame as a dressmaker.  The disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in the purchase of fashion materials such as cloths, threads, buttons, fasteners, etc.  Her dream is to have her own fashion clothing company.  She wishes to purchase a variety of cloths to create girls' clothing and other accessories.  This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in four years of continuous operation.  It is for these reasons that Natividad requests a loan to buy cloths to create girls' clothing and pay the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cloths to make clothing for girls and to pay the school expenses of her children.

loans.name: Heidy

texts.es: Heidy de 18 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Soledad con su familia. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos; los jugos natrales, postres y productos fritos los comercializa entre sus vecinos, quienes son los principales consumidores. Su madre la enseñó esta tarea y le vendió posteriormente su  negocio y hoy  Heidy quiere hacerlo crecer, por eso su meta es tener mayor capital y aumentar su liquidez para invertir. Su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente dinero  para invertir; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace   a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará frutas tropicales, azucar aceite, harina, grasas, lácteos etc., con el fin de incrementar la productividad, el volumen de sus ventas y dar una mayor liquidez a su negocio. Heidy realiza sus ventas de contado, diariamente trabajando consistentemente 8 hora diarias, para mejorar cada vez más sus ingresos tal como ella sueña.
texts.en: 18-year-old Heidy lives in the municipality of Soledad with her family. She has her own business selling food, natural juices, desserts, and fried food to her neighbours, who are her main customers. Her mother taught her this work and subsequently sold Heidy her business. Now Heidy wants to make the business grow; for this reason, her goal is to have greater capital and increase her liquid assets. Her greatest challenge is having enough money to invest; this is the reason why she is applying for a Kiva loan. It is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy tropical fruit, sugar, oil, flour, fats, dairy products, and other items in order to increase productivity and the volume of her sales and give her business greater liquidity. Heidy sells in cash and she works eight hours every day in order to keep increasing her income like she dreams of.

loans.use: to buy tropical fruit, sugar, oil, flour, fats, dairy products, etc

loans.name: Kensecia's Group

texts.en:
Kensecia is 37 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. 

Kensecia has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best-quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Kensecia also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Kensecia's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 39 years old. He is married with five children aged between 1 and 8 years old. One of them goes to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 18 years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 44 years old. She is married with six children aged between 4 and 20 years old, and five of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 21 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees for her children. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 25 years old. She is married with two children aged between 1 and 3 years. The children don't go to school yet. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past six years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru:
Хасан честный и добросовестный мужчина в возрасте 50 лет.  Он отец двоих прекрасных детей и заботливый муж. Они всей семей живут в деревне дружелюбно. Он занимается животноводством  вот уже на протяжения несколько лет. Хасан с детства любит животных. Он очень опытный скотовод. 
Сейчас он хочет расширит свою деятельность и хочет купить крупно рогатых скотов чтобы ухаживать, откармливать и продавать на местном рынке. С этим доходом он обеспечивает свою семью.  В настоящее время у него недостаточно денежных средства для покупки крупно рогатых скотов. Поэтому Хасан обратился в Арванд  для получение кредита и заранее благодарит Арванд за доверие и поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Hasan is an honest and conscientious man who is 50 years old.  He's the father of two beautiful children and is a caring husband.  They live together as a family in a village, and are all on good terms with each other.  

Hasan has been raising livestock for a few years; he's loved animals ever since he was little, and is a very experienced livestock farmer.  He currently wants to expand his business and wants to buy cattle to raise, fatten and sell at a local marketplace.  With this income, he provides for his family.  At the moment, he lacks the money to buy cattle, and has thus turned to Arvand for a loan.  He thanks Arvand in advance for their trust and support.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has no children. For the past seven years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his cookery business, selling kitchenware. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cookery items, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and complete his house. Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: buy more cookery items

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 11 years, Florence has been working hard to manage her restaurant, where food is cooked. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chairs, tables, soft drinks, and food, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and meet her family's financial needs. Florence hopes that in the future, she will be able to complete her residential house.

loans.use: to buy more chairs, tables, soft drinks, and food

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en:
Daphrose is 37 years old. She is married with four children aged between 2 and 10 years old. Two of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 17 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Mercelline's Group

texts.en:
Mercelline, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Mercelline will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Mercelline plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Mercelline’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has seven children, six of whom are currently in school. For the past 15 years, Annah has been working hard to manage her agriculture business, which sells agriculture inputs. 

To help expand her business, Annah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more agriculture inputs, and will help Annah to generate greater profits and meet her family's financial needs. Annah hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand into wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase more agriculture inputs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 63 años de edad, es casada, no tiene hijos, vive en casa propia en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito son personas amables que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de cuyes, pavos, gallinas, entre otros animales para incrementar su negocio, el préstamo le ayudará para ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes y de esta manera satifacer sus necesidades y preferencias, lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Virginia is 63 years old, is married and has no children. She lives in his own house in a rural district which is located in the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru. The locals are friendly and work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising animals.

She works raising and selling farm animals like chickens, turkeys, ducks, guinea pigs amongst others. She has been doing this business for 10 years and it is located in her house. She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs, turkeys, and chickens amongst other animals to expand her business. The loan will help her to offer a greater variety of animals to her clients and in this way satisfy their needs and preferences. This will have a positive impact on her level of income and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, turkeys, chickens amongst other animals to expand his business.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Barrio El Norte Callejon Los Buch Group

texts.es:
Antonieta (la primera del lado izquierdo de blusa blanca) es una señora de 37 años de edad tiene una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre seis meses y diez años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Antonieta para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano  en una de las principales calles de su comunidad, ella realiza este negocio desde hace  cinco años.
Ella ahora tiene la necesidad de incrementar su negocio de ropa de segunda mano,  pues la situación económica de las familia no se encuentra con condiciones buenas para comprar ropa nueva por lo que busca la ropa de paca, Antonieta a pesar de sus esfuerzos no ha sido posible incrementar el negocio, por tal motivo  se unió a un grupo de señoras para solicitar un prestamo que lo utilizara para comprar  media arroba de ropa de segunda mano y surtir mejor el negocio.
Antonieta tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para realizar la inversión y mejorar sus ingresos para comprar un terreno más grande.
texts.en:
Antonieta (first on the left, wearing a white blouse), is a woman of 37 and has a lovely family of five children with ages between six months and10 years. They live in the community of Sololá.

Antonieta sells second-hand clothing in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She sells on one of the main streets of her community,  and has been carrying on this business for five years.

Now she needs to expand her second-hand clothing business. As the family's financial situation does not allow her to purchase new clothing, she is seeking to buy second-hand this is what I hateclothing by the bundle.

In spite of her efforts, it has not been possible for Antonieta to expand the business. This is the reason she joined the group of women to request a loan that she will use to buy a half arroba (an arroba is 11.5 kilos) of second-hand clothing and better supply her business.
. 
Antonieta hopes to get the loan so that she can carry out the investment and improve her income in order to buy a larger piece of land.

loans.use: To buy and sell second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 38 años de edad, que se separó de su esposo y mediante un crédito quiere iniciar una actividad económica la cual ser la venta de mercancía por catálogo como lo son productos capilares, pijamas, ropa interior, productos de belleza etc., decidió tomar esta decisión por una necesidad económica ya que tiene que asumir los gastos del hogar y velar por el sostenimiento de su hijo de 11 años de edad.
Solicita un préstamo para comprar mercancía como lociones, productos capilares, productos de belleza, y suscripción a la revista y así iniciar a promocionar entre familiares y conocidos.
texts.en: María is 38 years old and separated from her husband. Through a loan she wants to start a business which is selling merchandise by catalog such as hair products, pajamas, underwear, beauty products etc. She decide to make this decision out of economic necessity as she has to take over the household expenses and watch out for the well-being of her 11 year old son. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as hair products, beauty products, a subscription to a magazine to begin her promoting to family members and friends.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like lotions, hair products, beauty products and a subscription to a magazine

loans.name: Ericka Paola

texts.es: Ericka Paola, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  materiales para poder hacer la construcción de un local donde pueda tener y desarrollar algunos cerdos para el engorde.  La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene y las buenas condiciones para ubicar un chiquero  para los cerdos. Además de obtener unos cerdos de buena calidad que a corto plazo puedan estar gordos y de buena calidad. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar la actividad, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en el proyecto y a la vez darle más ingresos económicos a su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ericka Paola is 18 years old, single and lives with her parents and siblings, who are her top priority. She intends to purchase materials with her loan in order to build a place where she can keep and develop some pigs for fattening. The idea is to take advantage of the space and good conditions that she has to place a pen for the pigs.

In addition, to obtain some good quality pigs that can be fat in the short term and of good quality. With this purchase, she could develop a business and at the same time have some savings. This will allow her to have more animals and to invest more in the project and to give more income to her family at the same time. 

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR . She had not previously had other loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided her a loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to raise pigs.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 36 años de edad, muy guerrera, trabajadora, humilde correcta dedica todos sus esfuerzos a atender su negocio de salón de belleza, ya que no tiene hijos ni pareja, su única preocupación son ayudar incondicionalmente a sus padres, siendo esta un gran aliciente para mejorar y proyectarse cada día más, atender un buen número de clientes y poner en marcha sus proyectos de compra de vivienda y tener la oportunidad de conocer países como Alemania, Francia, Italia, etc.

Ella en su negocio solamente se dedicaba a ofertar servicios, pero conformen iba pasando los días surgió una necesidad la cual fue comenzar a vender los productos que usaba en sus clientes.

En base a esta necesidad la señora Carmen quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una vitrina, surtida en tintas, gel, tratamiento, algunos accesorios, shampo, bálsamo, acondicionador etc.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 36-year-old woman who is a fighter. She is hardworking, humble, and courteous. She puts all of her effort into her beauty salon business. Since she does not have children or a partner, her only concerns are helping her parents unconditionally, this being a great incentive to better herself each day, helping a good number of customers, and setting her plans in motion to buy a house and have the opportunity to know countries such as Germany, France, Italy, etc.

In her business she only used to offer services, but as the days passed, the need arose to begin selling the products she was using on her customers.

Due to this need, Carmen wants to request a loan to buy a display cabinet, supplied with dyes, gel, treatment, some accessories, shampoo, balm, conditioner, etc.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and supply it with products such as dyes, gel, treatment, some accessories, shampoo, balm, and conditioner.

loans.name: Sandra Elena

texts.es:
Sandra es un ama de casa de 30 años de edad, dedicada a su esposo y a cuidar a sus 4 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad y en etapa de estudio, ella vive en un humilde hogar, su esposo era el encargado de cargar con todos los gastos del hogar, pero debido a mermas en su profesión no logra dar abasto a tantos gastos. Siendo muy consciente de esta situación Sandra inicio a pensar cómo podía ayudarlo y por recomendación de dos personas tenia para elegir dos negocios que era la venta de mercancía de por catálogo o la preparación de comida, pensando en su esposo e hijos opto por la preparación de alimento ya que tiene buena mano para cocinar y además le permite estar cerca de su familia para seguir desempeñando su papel de ama de casa.

Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual servirá para iniciar formalmente su empresa, que se dedicara a preparar almuerzos, desayunos, y productos fritos pro encargo, usara su cocina e implementos para iniciar y el préstamo lo destinara en comprar algunas ollas con las que no cuentan unos cucharones y compra de insumos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a housewife of 30, dedicated to her spouse and to taking care of her 4 children. They are all minors and in school. She lives in a humble home. Her husband was responsible for bearing all the household expenses, but due to losses in his profession is unable to cope with so many expenses.

Being well aware of this situation, Sandra started to think of how she could help, and by recommendation of two people, she had to choose between two businesses, that were, selling catalog merchandise or food preparation. Thinking of her husband and children, having a good hand for cooking, and also being able to be near her family to maintain her role as housewife, she opted for the preparation of food.

She wants a loan to be used to formally launch her company, which will be preparing lunches, breakfasts, and custom made fried products. She will use her kitchen and tools to start, and the loan will be used to buy some pots which she does not have, some buckets, and to buy supplies.

loans.use: to start a business, selling lunches, to help her husband, to buy pots, ladles, and supplies to prepare meals.

loans.name: Las Amigas De Villa Unión Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 5 mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “LAS AMIGAS DE VILLA UNIÓN” una de ellas es la Sra. ANA  de 34 años soltera y con 4 hijos, la Sra. ANA  se dedica ya hace 7 años a la crianza de animales(CERDOS) en un pequeño terreno todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de sus hijos, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. ANA  ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Seguir incrementando más animales para la crianza, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean profesionales es por eso  que la Sra. ANA   trabaja mucho ,Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más animales y también poder ampliar su negocio y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a la Sra. ANA es la que figura con una gorra blanca y polo negro con un diseño en forma de corazón, se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
"The Friends of Villa Union" is a group made up of five women responsible for distinct commercial activities. These are the members of the community group.

One of them is Ana, 34 years old and single with four children. Ana has spent seven years raising animals (pigs), succeeding in improving her home and supporting her children's education. 

To continue raising more animals for growth, her biggest desire is that her children are professionals. This is why Ana works a lot.

With the loan granted, she will invest in buying more animals and also expanding her business to have more income. Ana is the one wearing a white cap and black shirt with a heart-shaped design. 

She says goodbye with a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo and appreciates the loan given which will make her progress possible.

loans.use: to invest in more animals and an extension of the loction.

loans.name: Jonathan Andres

texts.es:
Desde 1998 por iniciativa, independencia, gusto al campo, por seguir los pasos de su padre el señor Jonathan inicio con su negocio de productor agropecuario, una actividad que hasta el día de hoy le ha permitido progresar, mantener a su familia, su esposa, sus dos hijos, tener otras perspectiva de la vida y que ahora sueña con mejorar su empresa tener más recursos para cuando sus hijos que tan solo tienen 7 y 1 año de edad cumplan una edad considerable mandarlos a la ciudad a instruirse en una buena universidad ese es su gran objetivo y que decidió poner en marcha hace 8 años cuando supo que su esposa estaban en embarazo.

Jonathan busca una sostenibilidad, regular una problemática de precio de venta de leche que ha quedado muy económica dando un gran golpe en su economía y necesita buscar alternativas para contrarrestar esta situación lo más lógico es comprar una nueva vaca lechera.

Jonathan necesita tu apoyo, el motivo es que quiere solicitar un préstamo para completar el dinero para comprar 5 reses, este préstamo le ayudara mucho en sus propósitos que mencionamos en un inicio, se compromete a pagar puntualmente las cuotas y en un futuro mandar a sus hijas a estudiar en una buena universidad de Medellín.
texts.en:
In 1998, with initiative, independence, a liking of the countryside, and a desire to follow in his father’s footsteps, Jonathan started his own business as a producer of agriculture and livestock. To this day, this business has allowed him to progress, to maintain his family of his wife and two children, and to have other life perspectives. Now he dreams of improving his business and having more resources so that when his children, who are only ages seven and one, reach a greater age, he can send them to the city to attend a good university. That is his greatest goal and the reason why he decided to set forth with his business eight years ago when he knew his wife was pregnant.

Jonathan seeks sustainability, to stabilize problems with the selling price of milk that have left him taking a big economic hit to his finances. He needs to look for alternatives to counteract this situation. The most logical thing is to buy a new milk cow.

Jonathan needs your help. He wants to request a loan to have enough money to buy five cows. This loan would help him a lot with his goals, which were previously mentioned. He promises to pay his payments on time and in the future to send his children to study at a good university in Medellín.

loans.use: to buy five cows.

loans.name: Istamboy

texts.ru:
Истамбой жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 35 лет. Он женатый человек у него есть двое детей и он должен их  выучить и накормить, и заботится о пожилых родителях. Он занимается колхозным хозяйством и животноводством. Кроме этого он работает мастером по ремонту в своей деревне. У него неплохой заработок но день за днем его дети взрослеют и он  с этим доходом не может обеспечивать свою семью. В этом году он решил купить ещё несколько голов скота и расширить свою деятельность. Для этого ему необходимо денежных средства.Он обратился в Арванд за кредитом.
 Он заранее благодарит за поддержку Арванду!!!
texts.en: Istamboy is a happy 35-year-old man. He is a married man with two children and has to educate and provide for them and care for his elderly parents. He is involved agriculture and animal husbandry. Besides this, he works as a repairman in his village. He has a decent salary, but his children are growing up, and he can no longer provide for his family with this income. This year, he decided to buy several more heads of livestock and expand his business. He needs money to accomplish this. He came to Arvand to request a loan. He thanks Arvand for the support in advance!!!

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to expand his business

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Simon is 27 years old and is often described as a very reliable person. He has one child and is married. As the group leader, Simon is representing his group of 8 farmers in the Kakamega North District in Kenya. He is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Simon's desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan, which is very exciting to him as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

Simon and his group will receive a total of 6 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and a solar light.

loans.name: Carmen Elina

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de 52 años de edad, ella tiene se dedica de lleno a la agricultora, nadie le ayudo a formar su negocio, todo fue obra de ella, se consiguió los recursos, trabaja en sus campos y se siente muy orgullosa por competir en el mercado con grandes productores.

Carmen es una mujer casada, cuenta con tres hijos, su propósito es seguir por una buena senda y en un futuro delegarle sus cultivos a su descendencia para que ellos continúen construyendo lo que ella dejo.

Carmen cultiva cacao y aguacates, tiene varias hectáreas que tienen un costo significativo para abonarlos, por eso en el momento quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en su totalidad en la compra de abono, con esto tendrá sus tierras abonas y espera para época de recolección de cosecha, tener productos de calidad y abundancia.

Tu apoyo será muy significativo para esta agricultora, tendrá la oportunidad de consentir sus cultivos y claro ella se compromete a pagar puntualmente la cuota ya que el beneficio que obtendrá por el préstamo será enorme y ante todo ella es agradecida.
texts.en:
Carmen is 52 years old. She fully dedicates herself to agriculture. No one helped her to start her business, all of it was her work. She obtained the resources, works on her farms, and she feels very proud to compete in the market with large producers. 

Carmen is a married woman; she has three sons. Her goal is to continue on a good path and in the future give her farming to her descendants so that they can continue constructing what she left.

Carmen grows cocoa and avocados. She has multiple hectares that cost a significant amount to support. For that reason, in this moment, she wants to ask for a loan to invest completely in the purchase of fertilizer. With this she will have her land fertilized and hopes that for the harvest season, to have products of quality and abundance.

Your help will be very significant for this farmer. She will have the opportunity to allow her farming and of course, she is committed to paying punctually the dues now that the benefit that she will obtain from this loan will be huge, and above everything, she is grateful.

loans.use: to invest a large capital to support all her hectares of avocado and cacao farms

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 33 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 8 years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her produce business which sells beans, groundnuts, rice, and cassava flour. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sacks of produce, and will help Oliver to generate greater profits and secure a shelter for her children. 

Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to achieve higher sales.

loans.use: to buy sacks of produce.

loans.name: Yazdon

texts.ru: Яздон добросовестный пожилой мужчина в возрасте 58 лет. Он заботливый отец и любящий муж. Они вместе с семьей живут в сельской местности. У него есть несколько соток земли где он выращивает кормовые культуры для скота и другие разные овощи, потом относят на рынок для продажи. С этим доходом он обеспечивает свою семью и пожилых родителей. Так как сейчас время посева Яздон хочет, купит семена овощных культур. Он надеется на хороший урожай. К сожалению в данный момент у него недостаточно денежных средств для покупки семян. Поэтому Яздон обратился в Арванд для получение кредита для посева. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en: Yazdon is a conscientious elderly 58-year-old man. He is a caring father and a loving father. He and his family live in a rural area. He has several ares of land, where he grows forage crops for livestock and other vegetables, and then sells them at a market. He provides for his family and elderly parents with this income. Since now is the sowing season, Yazdon wants to buy vegetable seeds. He hopes for a good harvest. Unfortunately, he currently does not have enough money to buy the seeds. This is why he came to Arvand to get a loan for sowing. He thanks Arvand for the support in advance!!!

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Kevina

texts.en:
Kevina is 30 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past seven years, Kevina has been working hard to manage her timber business, which sells timber and firewood.

To help expand her business, Kevina has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase logs, and will help Kevina to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Kevina hopes that in the future she will be able to earn profits.

loans.use: purchase logs.

loans.name: Kamariddin

texts.ru: Камариддин пожилой  мужчина в возрасте 51 лет, женат, отец троих детей. Он родился и вырос в сельской местности и с детства помогал отцу смотреть за домашним скотом. Вот уже несколько лет он занимается животноводством. В его делах ему помогает жена. Она доит коров и относит молоко на рынок для продажи. У Камариддина большая семья, он должен обеспечивать и свою жену с детьми, и пожилых родителей. Поэтому он подрабатывает так же пастухом. Он хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота, но у него недостаточно денежных средств. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд для получение кредита и надеется на положительные ответы с нашей стороны и благодарит Арванд за поддержку и доверие!!!
texts.en: Kamariddin is an elderly 51-year-old, married and a father of three children. He was born and grew up in a rural area and helped his father to look after livestock since his childhood. He has now been involved in animal husbandry for several years. His wife helps him with the business. She milks cows and takes the milk to a market for sale. Kamariddin has a large family and has to provide for his wife, children and elderly parents. This is why he also works as a shepherd. He wants to increase his livestock headcount, but does not have enough money. This is why he came to MDO Arvand to get a loan and hopes for positive responses from our side and thanks Arvand for support and trust!!!

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase his livestock headcount

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 64-year-old smallholder farmer based in Ndaragwa, which is an agricultural center near the famous Mount Kenya region. She owns a small piece of land together with her lovely husband, and they have been blessed with seven children. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for 20 years. Their main income sources are milk and crops.

From Kiva lenders, Agnes is seeking a loan worth KES 20,000 to grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, as is evident from the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to provide Agnes with access to a loan facility that will assist her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Agnes’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Slivie

texts.en:
Slivie, aged 29, is married with three children aged between 1 and 7 years old. One of them goes to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 14 years. Her husband is also a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees for her child.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past two years, Jacob has been working hard to manage his spare parts shop, which sells spare parts.

To help expand his business, Jacob has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase spare parts, and will help Jacob to generate greater profits and stock up the shop. Jacob hopes that in the future he will be able to become a distributor of spare parts.

loans.use: purchase spare parts

loans.name: Iriya

texts.en:
Iriya is 28 years old and married with three children, and he lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is a hardworking and honest person. 

He is a teacher by profession and has been teaching for twelve years. He supplements his income through farming. He is faced with the challenge of poor accessibility due to bad roads. He dreams of having a better standard of living and of being rich.   

Iriya would like this money to buy land for his family.

loans.use: to buy land for his family.

loans.name: Yessica Paola

texts.es:
Yessica es una joven de 24 años de edad, le gusta la independencia, desde joven busco su propio camino y ahora tiene su hogar, trabaja vendiendo alimentos, todo por mantenerse e ir adquiriendo mejores cosas poco a poco.

Aprendió de la cocina gracias a su hermana y ahora con su negocio dónde vende productos fritos en semana y comidas rápidas fines de semana logra generar el sustento para pagar su arriendo, servicios públicos y alimentación.

Yessica busca progresar quiere aprovechar su juventud para construir unas bases firmes de progreso, invirtiendo y apostándolo todo en su negocio, solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas, este préstamo le permitirá organizar mejor su negocio, y marcara un progreso al pasar de vender en una mesa a tener un puesto y no se detendrá, hasta convertir esto en un restaurante, tener una casa, empleados y la posibilidad de viajar por todo el mundo, conociendo preparaciones de otras lugares.
texts.en:
Yessica is a young woman of 24 years of age. She enjoys her independence. Since she was young, she sought her own way, and now has a home, works selling food, all to maintain and acquire better things, little by little.

She learned to cook from her sister, and now with her business, where she sells fried foods on weekdays, and fast foods on weekends, and manages to generate a living to pay her rent, utilities and food.

Yessica is looking forward to seizing her youth, to build a firm foundation of progress, investing and betting everything on her business. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of a fast food truck. This loan will allow her to better organize her business, and it will mark progress to to be able to sell at a table, and to have a seat. 

She will not stop until she turn this into a restaurant, has a house, employees, and the ability to travel around the world, learning preparations from other places.

loans.use: to invest in a fast food truck.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 33 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past six years, Johnson has been working hard to manage his wholesale shop, where he sells plastics. 

To help expand his business, Johnson has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy plates, saucepans, cups, flasks, glasses and trays, and will help Johnson to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Johnson hopes that in the future he will be able to have enough stock.

loans.use: to buy more plates, cups, saucepans, flasks, glasses and trays.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 41 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Michael has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, salt, sodas, detergent, flour and toilet paper. 

To help expand his business, Michael has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sacks of sugar, soap and salt, and will help Michael to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Michael hopes that in the future he will be able to have enough stock.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, soap and salt.

loans.name: Mirtha Tatiana

texts.es:
Mirtha es una mujer de 49 años de edad, casada, sin hijos, y estudia para ser profesora de primaria.
Ella es inteligente, entusiasta, emprendedora, decidida, responsable y trabajadora. Sus estudios los cursa en una universidad situada en la zona ‘San Pedro’ ubicado en el centro de la ciudad; de calles residenciales y otras populares, conserva una parte importante del patrimonio tangible de la ciudad en hermosas fachadas que evaden la arquitectura moderna. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 8-19 grados centígrados.
Mirtha es de tez trigueña, cabello negro lo usa corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que ya no habla, y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que trabaja como transportista, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Ella estudia para ser profesora de primaria, y se encuentra en segundo año de 3 que dura la carrera. Su principal actitud es la ‘pasión por la enseñanza’, conoce a fondo las materias y es capaz de mostrarles a sus alumnos que es una apasionada en el tema, de este modo sus alumnos se predisponen a aprender cada vez más. Otra de sus actitudes es la Paciencia porque trabaja con niños y adolescentes durante períodos de tiempo prolongados, su carácter es de servicio. “trabajo con niños desde hace más de 10 años, ahora estudio para sacar la licenciatura y postular para ser directora de primaria…” comenta. La ventaja de sus estudios es que lleva trabajando bastante tiempo en el rubro, la desventaja es el pago de las materias de la universidad. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios para graduarse y postularse para directora de primaria, ella desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que estudia.
Es por esos motivos que Mirtha solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil para terminar su licenciatura y ser directora del nivel primario de su escuela.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a 49-year-old woman, married with no children and she is studying to be a primary school teacher. She is intelligent, enthusiastic, enterprising, determined, responsible and hard-working. She is doing her studies in the district of 'San Pedro' in the city centre, with its residential and working-class streets it visibly conserves an important part of the city's heritage in its lovely façades that have escaped the influence of modern architecture. The climate here is cold and dry with a day time temperature of between 8°C and 19°C. 

Mirtha is olive-skinned, black hair that she keeps short, brownish-grey eyes, short in stature, average constitution and her mother tongue is Aymara, which she no longer speaks. She speaks Spanish for everyday use and for her studies. She shares her life with her husband who is a haulage contractor and they live in their own home built in brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof that has drinking water, mains gas and electricity and a drainage system. 

She is studying to be a primary school teacher, and she is currently in the 2nd year of a 3-year course. Her main attitude is 'passion for education', she knows the material in depth and she is capable of showing the children that she is passionate about the subjects, so that her pupils are always willing to learn more. Another of her assets is patience because she works with young children and teenagers for long periods of time, she has a helpful personality. 

"I have been working with children for over 10 years, now I'm studying for my degree and to be able to apply for a post as head of primary...," she says. The advantage for her studies is that she has been doing this kind of work for some time, the disadvantage is the cost of university courses. Her dream is to finish her studies, graduate and apply to become head of primary. She would like to buy a laptop to continue her studies. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years she has been studying. Mirtha is requesting the loan to buy a laptop to finish her degree and become head of primary at her school.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to finish her degree and become head of the primary level in her school.

loans.name: Erickson's Group

texts.en:
Erickson's Group is formed by 10 farmers from Kakamega North district, and is represented by Erickson who is the group leader pictured above. He is 22 years old and has been a farmer for six years. He is often referred to as a very experienced farmer.

Erickson isn’t new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed that his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. This year, Erickson will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Erickson's Group will purchase a total of eight solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is 29 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Issa has been working hard to manage his produce shop, where he sells beans, maize flour and rice. 

To help expand his business, Issa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize flour, rice and beans to sell. The loan will help Issa to generate greater profits, increase his stock and add more items to attract more customers. Issa hopes that in the future he will be able to own more rental houses. 

Issa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs such as Issa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Alosius

texts.en:
Alosius is 34 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Alosius has been working hard to manage his produce business, where he sells produce such as rice, millet and beans. 

To help expand his business, Alosius has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy rice, millet and beans to sell, and will help Alosius to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Alosius hopes that in the future he will be able to have enough stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, millet and beans to sell.

loans.name: Doris Elena

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer de 42 años de edad, se dedica a la comercialización de pollos, como se puede ver en la foto trata de ser muy organizada en su negocio, tiene alimentadores y bebedores, y un espacio adecuado para ellos, su negocio se lo enseño hacer su esposo y hoy en día es este negocio el que le permite generar los ingresos para alimentarse y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Los pollos de Doris son famosos en el área, son muy grandes y alimentados solo con cuido, son pollos de un rico sabor y gracias a ellos tiene buenas propuestas para trabajar.

Con mucha alegría Doris quiere solicitar un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la ampliación de sus galpones, comprara pollos de engorde y alimento, se siente feliz porque no llego a pensar que este negocio que inicio desde el año 2013 fuera a darle buenos frutos y le permitiera crecer al ritmo que lo está haciendo.
texts.en:
Doris is 42 years old and makes a living selling chickens. As you can see in the photo, Doris tries to be very organised at her work. She has feeders and water bottles, and a space set up for the chickens. Doris learned her trade from her husband and today this business allows her to earn an income to feed herself and improve her quality of life.

Doris’ chickens are famous in the local area. They are very big and fed with great care. They have a rich flavour and, thanks to all this, Doris has good job opportunities.

Doris is happily applying for a loan that she will use to expand her business by buying chickens and feed. Doris started this business in 2013 and is happy because she never imagined that it was have such positive results and allow her to expand as quickly as she has.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying chickens and feed.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis Fernando todo un señor de 54 años de edad, respetuoso, es soltero, siempre apoyo a sus familiares y busca mucho progresar, tener sus ahorros, no sabe qué día pueda enfermar y aprovecha cada día para trabajar y disfrutar de una buena vida, trabaja como independiente realizando trabajos de construcción, uno de los trabajos que más le solicitan es pegar cerámica, este trabajo como independiente lo viene realizando desde el año 1995, pero tiene una amplia experiencia trabajando como ayudante de obra que era su antiguo trabajo.

Luis Fernando siempre trabaja pro mejorar su vivienda, por vivir cómodamente, tener un plato de comida, por apoyar sus sobrinos ya que no tiene hijos, por superación personal, busca sostenibilidad de negocio y prácticamente solo le queda realizar su trabajo como independiente, el motivo es por gusto y por su avanzada edad puesto que se torna difícil encontrar trabaja en Colombia por el tema de la pensión.

Luis Fernando se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en maquinaria, desea comprar una brilladora de cerámica ya que la suya es bastante vieja y no funciona.
texts.en:
Luis Fernando is 54 years old. He is respectful, and single. He always supports his relatives and works hard to find ways to progress in life. Luis has savings for a rainy day, and works every day and enjoys a good life. Luis works as an independent builder. One of the jobs that he most commonly contracted for is placing ceramic tiles. Luis has been working independently since 1995 but he previously had worked as labourer and has a lot of experience.

Luis always works in order to improve his home, to live comfortably with a roof over his head, and to have food on his table. He works to support his nieces and nephews as he himself has no children. Luis also works in order to beat his own achievements, and wants sustainability at his business. This is the only work that Luis can do. Given his advanced age, it is very difficult to find work in Colombia.

Luis is applying for a loan in order to invest in equipment for his work. He wants to buy a tool for cleaning ceramic as his is quite old and no longer works.

loans.use: to buy a tool for cleaning ceramic.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new work tools to replace his current ones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron rods to build a verandah onto his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and building rods to continue building her home.

loans.name: Jussefa

texts.pt:
A senhora Jussefa tem 29 anos de idade, é casada, mãe de 3 filhos, todos menores de idade, 2  frequentando o ensino primário e 1 ainda sem idade escolar,vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar açucar, amendoim, feijão, óleo e massa para reforçar o seu negócio.
Seu sonho e esperança para o futuro e adiquirir uma viatura para o uso pessoal, ver seu negócio a crescer e ter uma criação de gado.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz um xitique mensal como forma de poupar e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Jussefa is a 29 year old married mother to 3 young children, 2 of whom already attend school and one is still of pre-school age. She lives in her own home. She says that she plans to use this loan to buy sugar, nuts, beans, cooking oil and dough so that she can re-stock her business. Her hopes and dreams for the future include buying a vehicle of her own, seeing her business grow and setting up a business raising cattle. The greatest challenge that she faces is her lack of money and each month she pays into an informal credit and savings group, known as a xitique, as a means to overcoming this situation and saving for the future. She also hopes to apply for further loans so that she can fulfil her plans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, nuts, beans, cooking oil and dough.

loans.name: Yoleisa

texts.es: Yoleisa de 40 años, se dedica a la  venta de textos, helados además de meriendas para estudiantes.  Ella tiene más de 6 años de experiencia en este negocio, el cual nació por la necesidad de apoyar a su familia, en el mejoramiento de los ingresos y poder suplir sus necesidades y atendiendo a que su madre directora y propietaria  de un colegio, le dio la oportunidad de aprovechar ese mercado, para que generara ingresos.   Su meta es lograr totalmente ser independiente y mas adelante generar empleo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará uniformes, útiles escolares, recargas y textos que han sido solicitado por los estudiantes. Con esta inversión logrará tener un surtido adaptado al requerimiento de su clientela e impulsará su negocio hacia la generación de más ingresos y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Yoleisa, 40, sells text books, ice cream and afternoon snacks to students.  She has six years' experience in the business which she started out of a necessity to earn more income to support her family.  Her mother, the owner and director of a school, gave Yoleisa the opportunity to take advantage of the market and generate an income for herself, with a goal toward becoming totally independent and, in the future, generating employment.

She is currently requeting a CrediKiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy school uniforms, materials, phone recharges and text books to meet student demand.  With this investment she will have a stock of merchandise adapted to customer needs.  This will boost business and generate more income, which is exactly what will make her CrediKiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: To buy school uniforms, materials, phone recharges and text books.

loans.name: Aida

texts.pt:
Vive maritalmente, tem 4ª classe, mãe de 6 filhos, 3 maiores de idade e 3 menores todos a estudarem, é agricultora a muitos anos junto com o marido tido como um dos grandes agricultores do Distrito. Está a tomar o credito pela primeira vez com a Hluvuku.
Pretende comprar insumos  agrícolas , fertilizantes, adubos, etc para pulverizar no seu campo na produção de diversas hortícolas.
Ela gostaria de poder construir um estabelecimento comercial perto de casa para vender diversos produtos alimentares e descansar de praticar a agicultura, porque é muito cansativo.
texts.en: Aida is educated to 4th grade level and she lives with her husband and their 6 children, 3 of whom are older and the remaining 3 are still quite young but they all attend school. She has farmed alongside her husband for many years and they have become some of the most successful farmers in the district. This will be her first time applying for a loan with Hluvuku. She plans to buy farming supplies, fertilisers and feeds to spray on the land where she grows a wide range of vegetables. She would like to be able to build a shop close to her home so that she can sell her range of produce and have a rest from farming because it is very tiring work.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, fertilisers and and feeds to spray over her land when growing a range of vegetables

loans.name: Jorge Eliecer

texts.es:
Jorge Eliecer es un hombre soltero de 45 años de edad, que trabaja diariamente por mejorar las condiciones de su vida, vivienda, busca salir de la pobreza, él tiene 3 hijos que mantener y es un motivo emocional más para superarse, como pueden ver en la foto es un hombre humilde pero sonriente que solo busca progresar, cosas buenas para su familia, que vivan bien y felices.

Ya que Jorge no cuenta con capital para su negocio, quiere solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en pollos de engorde, alimento, adecuación del galpón, tres pilares fundamentales para mejorar su negocio.

Este préstamo será de gran aporte para Jorge comercialmente ya que tendrá animales para buscar buenas negociaciones, y una base firme para juntar ingresos para posibles inversiones ya que para él es más cómodo pagar por cuotas, pero le mayor beneficio que obtendrá será en lo económico, sus ingresos mejoraran y será más competitivo en el sector.
texts.en:
Jorge Eliecer, 45, is a single man. He works every day to improve his living conditions and leave poverty. He has three children to support, which is an additional motivation to get ahead. As it can be seen in the picture, he is a humble man. However, he keeps smiling and looking ahead, and works to guarantee that good things happen to his family and that they can live happily.

Jorge does not have enough money for his business, so he is requesting a loan to buy broilers and animal feed, and repair his pen. These are three fundamental pillars for the improvement of his business.

This loan will be of great help for Jorge from a financial perspective, since he will now have animals and will be able to get better deals. It will also help him to be able to save for future investments, since the possibility of paying monthly installments is beneficial for him. However, the greatest benefit will be the improvement of his income and the possibility of becoming more competitive.

loans.use: to buy broilers and animal feed, and repair his pen.

loans.name: Flor Edy

texts.es:
Flor María es una vendedora de mercancía por catálogo, ella ha superado difíciles adversidades, siempre demostrando con carácter y temperamento que la ha caracterizado y le ha ayudado en su negocio dado que trasmite mucha seguridad y confianza a sus clientes.

Ella es una mujer que quedo viuda, no tuvo hijos por ello encontró en sus ventas un gran apoyo para poder cargar con los gastos de su hogar, y como en todo negocio tiene tiempos difíciles en donde las deudas abarcan gran parte de sus ganancias dejando con poco para invertir en mercancía.

Flor trabaja no para mantenerse, trabaja para salir adelante, tener un local propio, un carro, y es por ello que siempre busca oportunidades para crecer. Anteriormente Flor solo vendía productos de uso personal tal y como lo podemos ver en la foto pero ahora quiere incursionar en la ropa y calzado, razón por la cual busca un apoyo  crediticio para la compra de mercancía de ropa y calzado para hombre y mujer.
texts.en:
Flor Maria sells merchandise by catalogue.  She has overcome difficult adversities, always demonstrating the strength of character that characterizes her, which has helped in her business since she transmits great security and trust to her customers.

She is a widow with no children, so going into sales was a great support when taking care of household expenses.  As in every business, there are difficult times when debt takes a good chunk out of the profit, leaving little to invest in merchandise.

Flor works to support herself, to get ahead, to have her own shop and a car.  So she is always looking for opportunitiesd to grow.  Flor used to sell personal care products as shown in the photo, but now she has gone into clothing and shoes.  Therefore she is seeking a loan to buy men's and women's clothing and shoes.

loans.use: To buy beautiful men's and women's clothing and shoes to sell to shops.

loans.name: Unique School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fr. Paul. He is the Director of Unique High School, a mixed school in the rural area of Rubirizi in Mbarara with 400 students. Unique School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Unique School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Fr. Paul ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, James has been working hard to manage his produce business, which sells produce like beans, rice, and posho. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help James to generate greater profits and increase stock. 

James hopes that in the future he will be able to buy plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more produce

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Gerald has been working hard to manage his carpentry business. 

To help expand his business, Gerald has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber and will help Gerald to generate greater profits. 

Gerald hopes that in the future he will be able to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more timber.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 33 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Robert has been working hard to manage his clinic.

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drugs and will help Robert generate greater profits. 

Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to complete his house.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs.

loans.name: Luz Dari

texts.es:
