Daria has been in the pig fattening business for two years and also earns income from a beauty salon. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is married and has four children. For the past seven years she has worked hard making a living by fishing in the Philippines. She also earns an income from her sari-sari, or general store.

Airene successfully repaid a previous loan through NWTF, and she has now requested another loan to further build her businesses. With 1500 PHP she will buy materials for new fishing cages such as netting and bamboo.

Airene has been sustaining her livelihood through her own efforts and with the help of her NWTF loan. She is working to save enough money to send her children to college and develop her business further.

loans.use: to buy materials for new fishing cages such as netting and bamboo.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Geraldine works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Geraldine is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Pally

texts.en:
A mother of four dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, Pally is 36 years old. Because of her family, she sells fish and also works for others for a fee to earn additional income.

For Pally, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to renovate her house.

She hopes that she can update her lifestyle to have a better standard of living than before.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase crushed plastic raw materials for her husband to manufacture plastic accessories.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She is a widow and has three children. She lives in a small village in bad conditions. In order to have a better standard of living, she tries to work hard in agriculture. She plants wheat and potatoes. 

Gulnora is a strong, wise and kind person. It is hard for her to feed her family and raise three children. They need to live in better conditions, and Gulnora is requesting a loan to renovate her house. She awaits Kiva lenders' mercy and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a wise woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1988. She is living in a rural area at a small village.

She is a helpful and supportive child of their family. She is a teacher at a secondary school. She also has a business in agriculture. She has cattle and plants wheat on her land.

In her free time, she is busy with sewing women’s traditional dresses. Fotima works hard and wants to feed her family. She requested a loan to buy a sewing machine and start a new business. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who does business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business. Mary Grace has been in this business for five years and earns more income from pig raising. 

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 33 years old with three children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Jenny has borrowed and paid fifteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jenny aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Morina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Morina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Ma. Morina is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Ma. Morina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Zenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell for her business.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who does business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns more income from food vending and from buying and selling vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. She aspires to build and expand her businesses to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in mud, black dye, clay, and firewood in order to make pots, pitchers, clay griddles, etc. She hopes to meet the demand from her customers.

loans.name: Rubail

texts.en:
Rubail is 30 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and parents in Bolnisi district.

Rubail trades in fruits and vegetables in Bolnisi. He needs money to purchase stock of fruits and vegetables and requested a loan. The Start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 1,500 USD.

With the received credit, he will purchase additional stock and will increase the turnover and increase his income as well.

loans.use: to purchase stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Evelin Rosibel

texts.es:
Evelin, tiene un negocio que consiste en atender un chalet en el que vende tortas y bebidas, lo tiene desde hace un año, tiene una empleada que le ayuda a realizar sus actividades; Evelin vive con sus padres, abuelos, hermanos y un pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar verduras, embutidos, bebidas, aderezos, etc., para la elaboración de tortas, espera cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, atenderlos mejor, incrementar sus ventas y continuar cubriendo las necesidades de su hijo.
Sus sueños son mantener su negocio bien surtido para tener los recursos necesarios para darle a su hijo un mejor futuro y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en: Evelin has a business taking care of a house from where she sells sandwiches and drinks. She has had this business for a year and has an employee who helps her with her work. Evelin lives with her parents, grandparents, siblings and a young 5 year old son. She will use the loan to buy vegetables, sausages, drinks, dressings, etc. to prepare sandwiches in order to fulfill her customers' demands, to serve them better, to increase her sales and to keep on covering her son's needs. Her dreams are to keep her business well stocked in order to have the necessary resources to give her son a better future and to finish paying off her debt.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, sausages, drinks, dressings, etc. in order to prepare sandwiches and fulfill her customers' demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix her husband's lathe machine and purchase cutting tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various fruit, vegetables and an equilibrium scale for her husband's fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of one kid living in Kampong Cham province, Sinoun is 22 years old. She earns income via rice cropping on a one hectare area to support her family. Moreover, she can earn additional income via working for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for ages. It earns her about 37,100 KHR per day.

For Sinoun, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully.

In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland and make it bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ermonedie

texts.en:
Ermonedie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional wood and bamboo for her furniture making business.

Ermonedie has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising livestock.

Ermonedie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood and bamboo for her business.

loans.name: Egna

texts.en:
She has a business farming ornamental plants in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Egna is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers, other varieties of plants, plastic containers, etc. for her ornamental plants business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Egna has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, other varieties of plants, plastic containers, etc.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Genalyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more dry goods to sell in her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Genalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Romanita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Romanita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell eggs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Romanita is borrowing PHP 27,500 through NWTF to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell for her buy and sell eggs business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Romanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Eva earns additional income as a fish pond operator.

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase more coconut meat to sell for her business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Venancia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell used clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling peanuts. Venancia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional used clothes to sell.

Venancia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothes to sell

loans.name: Luneta

texts.en:
Luneta is 41 year old married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Luneta has a buy & sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Luneta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Thy is 45 years old and a mother of six children. She grows rice on a two-hectare area as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 37,000 KHR per day.

This is the third cycle loan for Thy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan. She leads a group of five members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland bigger than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin has been a taxi driver for 17 years. He is married with two children. Elchin’s wife is a housewife. His family are IDPs (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city. Now they live in the Fuzuli region.

Elchin has applied for a loan in the amount of 800 AZN for repairs to his car. He wants to repair his car’s salon (interior). Elchin hope that, after the repairs, his business and monthly income will be better. This is Elchin's second loan; he repaid his first loan on time.

Elchin is thankful to Komak and the Kiva organization for help. In the future he wants to help his children with their education and make repairs to his house.

loans.use: to repair his car’s salon (interior), increase his monthly income and, in future, help educate his children and repair his house.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is 47 years old. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a small village. She is a widow and has three children. She has 18 years experience of doing business. She is busy with keeping and selling cattle. She knows her activity well and loves to work. 

Matluba lives in old house and wants to build new one. Unfortunately the income that she earns from her business is not enough to build a house. She saved up money but it is not enough, that is why she asked a loan from KIVA lenders to build a new house in the place of the old one. She awaits your support.

loans.use: build a new house

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a hardworking woman. She was born in a family of farmers in 1963. She is married and has three children. She has seventeen years experience of doing business in agriculture. She keeps feeds and sells livestock and likes to do a business. She is hardworking person and knows well her activity. Basically she feeds livestock and her husband and children sell them in the domestic market. 

Matluba needs to renovate the place where she keeps the livestock in order to have good quality cattle. She is asking financial support from KIVA lenders to renovate the place of keeping cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: renovate cattle enclosure

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en: Gulcherha has ten years experience doing business. She is married and has three children. She lives in the northern part of Tajikistan in a small district. She has a business of raising and selling livestock. She loves to work in agriculture. She had a dream to open a farm from her childhood. She started with two calves and one cattle, and then increased in amount. Now she wants to buy additional cattle and widen her business. She hopes someday she would open a farm. She is asking a loan from KIVA lenders to buy cattle. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: Zuhro is an active woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is married and has three children. She has twelve years of practice in keeping livestock and knows well her duties. She loves cattle and takes care of them. She feeds and raises the cattle and her husband helps  her trade them in the domestic market. She requested financial support from KIVA lenders to buy more cattle. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Elenita has been in this business for 3 years. Elenita earns more income from buy and sell fish.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: buy fishing net

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Laura is 46 years old and four of her children who are in school.

Laura has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Laura has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen and his mother are greatly thankful for their first and very helpful deal with Kiva lenders and hope for a second partnership. Armen and his mother live in the village of Tsovagyugh in the region of Gegharkunik.  

Armen is 26 years old and he is a student at the Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute studying History. Together with his mother, Armen lives here happily and takes care of their small farm, which is the only source of income for Armen’s family. Here he takes care of cows, calves, heifers, bulls, a pig and chickens.  

Armen mentions that after having higher education he will manage to improve his family’s living conditions being engaged both in farming and also working as a teacher of history at the local school.  He again is having financial hardships with paying for his education.  He is asking for this loan as he must pay his tuition fee for the current semester. With great hope he waits and desires that this time again his deal with Kiva lenders will be great for him.

loans.use: pay his university fees

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo lives with his peasant family in Gavar city of the Gegharkunik region. Kamo is married and he has a son, who is just back from the army. Being currently unemployed he, with pleasure, greatly helps his parents in farming and agriculture.

Kamo is a skilled farmer with a not small farm. He has cows, calves, heifers and a lot of sheep. He sells a lot of meat from his farm, mostly mutton, which is always fresh and of high quality. His wife sells milk and cheese and all these make their family income enough for their immediate needs only. Kamo, with his son, also grows potatoes, cucumbers and tomatoes on his land which he sell to re-sellers.

Kamo wants this loan of 700,000 AMD for the purchase of two calves and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Heriberto De Jesus

texts.es:
Heriberto, vive en casa propia con sus compañera de vida la cual se dedica a realizar labores domésticas y dos hijos que ya trabajan, él se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a cultivar granos básicos, actividad que aprendió a desarrollarla con el apoyo de sus padres y como fuente de ingresos para su familia lo realiza desde hace más de 15 años.
Comprará ganado para aumentar el número de animales y tener mejores ingresos, con la inversión  busca seguir trabajando, atraer nuevos clientes y salir adelante con sus compromisos.
Los sueños que tiene Heriberto son mejorar su situación financiera y la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en: Heriberto lives in his own house with his life companion who works doing house work and his two children who now work. He works raising cattle and growing basic grains, activities he learned to do with the help of his parents. It has been the source of income for his family for more than 15 years. He will buy cattle to increase the number of animals he has and increase his income. With this investment he is looking to continue his work. attract new clients and get ahead with his commitments. Heriberto's dream is to improve his financial situation and the infrastructure of his house.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase the number of animals he has and increase his income.

loans.name: Chhet's Group

texts.en:
Chhet is 27 years old and is a married woman who has two dependent children that she has to look after. Chhet lives in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. The source of her family income is from rice farming, feeding pigs and working for other farms. This has been for nine years. She could earn around 49,400 KHR per day and could save around 6,300 KHR per day when needed.

This is the first loan for Chhet with VisionFund, in her group which consists of two members. As the leader, she decided to borrow a loan from VisionFund with the purpose of buying more small pigs to feed and food for them. She wishes to expand her current business and to make her family have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more small pigs to feed.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Theang

texts.en: A mother of one kid living in Kratie province, Theang is 23 years old. Nowadays, she can earn income to support her family’s living via rice cropping. For Theang, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kratie province, Kunthy is 46 years old and the mother of one child. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice and builds houses to earn extra income. This is the second cycle for Kunthy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farm. She hopes that she can get more yield from her farm than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her farm.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en:
Sokhon is years old and is a married mother of three children, two of them are still dependent.  Sokhon lives in a rural area of Cheung Prey district in  Kompong Cham province.  The main source of her family income is from rice farming.  For twenty-six years she has been farming to support her family. To  help to earn more income, Sokhon also works as a construction worker. She can earn around 50,000 KHR per day and save around 25,000 KHR each day. 

Sokhon’s group consists of 3 members, and this is the second loan for her with KIVA’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. The previous loan helped her to have a better house to live in. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer to do her farming. She hopes that she could earn more income to fulfill her dream of expanding her current business.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sreyny's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of the Battambang province, Sreyny is 28 years old and the mother of one kid. She grows cassava as the main source of income and raises pigs to supplement her income. For Sreyny, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seed and pesticide to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family’s living better than before.

loans.use: To buy seed and pesticide to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Mardy's Group

texts.en:
Mardy is 46 years old.  She lives in the Prey Chhor district of Kompong Cham province. She a married woman who lives in a family with five dependent children, four of them are in school.  For twenty six years, the main source of her family income has been from selling grocery.  To better support her family and to earn more income, Mardy also works for other farms in her village as well.

Mardy’s group consists of three members and this loan is the second loan for her with KIVA’s partner, VisionFund. The previous loan helped her and her family to have a better living condition. After paying off the last loan, Mardy decides to lead a group to take another loan to repair her house. She hopes  that she could earn more  money and have enough to keep sending her children to school until they get a good job.

loans.use: to repair her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Masy's Group

texts.en: Masy’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Masy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: buy a water filter

loans.name: Corina Del Carmen

texts.es: Corina de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres nietos, el se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 9 años,  vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Corina, 62, lives in her own house with her 3 grandchildren. She makes a living selling men's and women's clothing. She has been doing this activity for 9 years. She sells door to door in the various communities located near her house. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to get ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing at wholesale in order to continue with her sales and thus be able to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Maharlika

texts.en:
Maharlika is a married woman with three children. She is 44 years old and all three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Maharlika has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Maharlika requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

In the future, Maharlika would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Vazgen

texts.en:
Vazgen successfully completed his first loan and first partnership with Kiva lenders. The loan served for repairing his cattle barn, which is now cuter and warmer for the cold periods of the year.

Vazgen lives in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region with his wife and son and, as before, all the family is busy with farming. On his farm, Vazgen has cows, calves, piglets and chickens. The sale of his farm products provides his family income for their everyday immediate needs, which are very acute.

Vazgen relies on the help of Kiva lenders once more, as his farm cattle has a lack of fodder. He is going to spend this loan of 150,000 AMD on the purchase of some animal fodder for his farm cattle till the pastures become green with fresh grass.

loans.use: for the purchase of some animal fodder for his farm cattle till the pastures will become green with fresh grass

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Chanthy, 31, lives with family members in a rural village of Battambang province. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is in school while the other one is too young. For her living, she grows rice on a four-hectare area. Moreover, her husband is a blacksmith to earn more income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 42,400 KHR per day. This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more yield and more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee.

loans.name: Phorn's Group

texts.en: An old woman from Battambang province, Phorn is 60 years old and the mother of four children. She can earn income to improve her family's condition via growing sesame and corn on a 12-hectare area. For Phorn, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a cow, corn seed, fertilizer and pay for labor to plow her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to update her family better than before.

loans.use: to buy a cow, corn seed, fertilizer and pay for labor to plow her farm.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en: A resident living in Kampong Cham province, Yoeun is 45 years old and the mother of two children. To support her living, she grows rice and cashews as the main source of her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 36,700 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the land fee to support her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's condition to be better than before.

loans.use: to pay the land fee to support her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Ros, 55, lives with family members in a rural area of Kampong Cham province and is the mother of four children. Nowadays, she earns income to support her family’s living via growing cassava. In addition, she grows cashews to earn extra income. For Ros, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay the plowing fee to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland bigger than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the plowing fee to support her farmland.

loans.name: Sopheatra's Group

texts.en:
Sopheatra is 31 years old and lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is a married woman who lives in a family with two children, and they are all still dependent on her. The source of her family income has been from working at an electric shop and feeding chickens for eight years.

This is the first loan for Sopheatra’s group which consists of two members. She is now leading this group to borrow a loan from VisionFund with her portion to buy more chicken to feed. She hopes that this loan will help her expand her current business and be enough to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to feed

loans.name: Kimyout's Group

texts.en:
Kimyot is originally lives in a rural area of Prey Chhor district of Kompong Cham province. She is 37 years old and a married woman who has three children, two of them are dependent children. The main source of her family income is from working in tree-cutting. She has also done farmwork for others for seventeen years.

Kimyot’s group consists of three members, and this is the second loan for her with VisionFund. The past loan, helped her to have a better standard of living. Now she is leading this group to take the loan with a portion for repairing her old house.

She hopes that she could earn more income in order to have better living conditions and good health.

loans.use: to repair her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Olga Patricia

texts.es: Olga de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas y tortillas, el esposo le ayuda en las ventas, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en esa actividad, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con su familia, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, cal, frijoles, etc. todo por mayor y asi poder seguir con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Olga, 37, lives in her own house with her life partner and their 3 children. She makes and sells ‘pupusas’ (stuffed tortillas) and tortillas. Her partner assists her with the selling. She has 5 years of experience doing this activity. Her business is located near her home in a very busy area. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to get herself and her family ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy corn, fresh cheese, 'chicharrón' (pork rind), lime, beans, etc., at wholesale so that she can continue with her sales in order to earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy corn, fresh cheese, 'chicharrón' (pork rind), lime, beans, etc., at wholesale.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, ha utilizado los créditos para mantener e ir mejorando la venta de tortillas, leña y cosméticos, pues de esa manera puede generar los ingresos necesarios para ir cubriendo las necesidades básicas de su familia y reducir sus deudas.
Está necesitado de más capital para comprar leña, maíz, cal y bolsas, para elaborar la venta de tortillas y así mantener la continuidad de su negocio, espera administrar muy bien el nuevo crédito para tener buenos resultados.
texts.en: Teresa has used loans to maintain and improve her sale of tortillas, wood and cosmetics. In this way she can generated the income needed to cover the basic necessities of her family and reduce her debt. She needs more capital to buy wood, corn, lime and bags to make her tortillas sales. In this way she can maintain her business. She hopes to administrate the new loan and have good results.

loans.use: to buy wood, corn, lime and bags to make her tortillas sales and continue with her business.

loans.name: Sabounyouma Group

texts.fr:
C’est Gaoussou qui a mis ses mains sur la brebis.
Gaoussou  est un homme âgé  de 28 ans, marié et père de deux enfants ,aucun d’entre eux  n’a l’ âge  d’ aller à l’école , sa femme fait  le petit  commerce  pour  subvenir à ses besoins.
Il  fait embouche dans leur village qui est situé au  Mali. Il n’a pas  eu la chance d’aller  à l’école.
 Il achète  ces moutons  au marché et  revend dans  un autre marché plus loin. C’est le manque d’argent  qui lui a poussé à prêter de l’argent chez RMCR.
Gaoussou  peut acheter un mouton  à 50 000f l’engraisse durant quelques mois, son bénéfice  peut atteindre 35 000f à la vente. Depuis  10 ans il exerce ce travail dans son  village et l’activité nous plait à  cause des gains que nous gagnons.
Par fois les  maladies  des moutons  nous  fatiguent et nous  perdons des moutons .
texts.en:
Gaoussou is [the borrower] with his hand on the ewe. He is a 28-year-old married man and the father of two children, neither of whom is yet old enough to attend school. Gaoussou's wife runs a small business to meet her needs.

Gaoussou raises livestock in their village in Mali. He did not have the opportunity to attend school. Gaoussou purchases sheep at the market and sells them at another market, further away. It is a lack of funds that has driven him to borrow money from RMCR.

Gaoussou can purchase a sheep for 50,000 CFA francs, fatten it for several months, and [receive] a profit of up to 35,000 CFA francs upon selling it. He has been doing this work in his village for 10 years and he likes it because of the profit he makes. Sometimes the sheep [become ill, which] is tiring, and we [sometimes] lose sheep.

loans.use: To purchase sheep to sell.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, todos son dependientes de él, no tiene apoyo financiero del extranjero, se dedica a trabajar en la tierra cultivando maíz, frijol, maicillo, etc., el oficio lo aprendió cuando por necesidad de más recursos económicos buscaba empleo con otras personas, su jornada de trabajo inicia a las siete de la mañana y finaliza a las cuatro de la tarde, lo está realizando de manera independiente desde hace 15 años.
Comprará abono, semilla de maíz, fertilizantes y pagara mozos para preparar la tierra en la que realiza la siembra, espera iniciar los procesos agrícolas en el tiempo justo para aprovechar la época de invierno y tener una cosecha más productiva. 
Su sueño es construir su vivienda de ladrillo para tener mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and children. They are all dependent on him and he doesn't have any other financial support. He works in agriculture, growing corn, beans, sorghum, etc. José learned this trade when, out of necessity for more money, he looked for work with other people. His workday starts at 7:00 a.m. and ends at 4:00 p.m. He has been working independently for 15 years.

José will buy manure, corn seeds, fertilizer, and will pay for workers to prepare the land for planting. He hopes to start the agricultural processes at just the right time in order to make the most of the winter and have a more productive harvest. His dream is to build a brick house so he can have a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, corn seeds, fertilizer, and to pay for workers to prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Daniel Alejandro

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre de 27 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de ingeniería de sistemas.
Él es inteligente, alegre, feliz, atento, amable, comprometido con sus estudios y muy responsable. Sus estudios los cursa en un universidad privada situada en la zona de ‘Achachicala’ que es uno de los barrios más tradicionales de la ciudad, Su nombre se debe a las grandes rocas que se encuentran en el lugar desde el período prehispánico; piedras a las que los pobladores les han atribuido poderes mágicos e hipnóticos, y que han sido material de leyenda. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 8-18 grados centígrados.
Daniel es de tez morena, cabello negro lo usa corto, ojos pardos, baja estatua, su lengua materna es el Aymará que ya no habla y habla español por cultura general y por los estudios que realiza. Su vida la efectúa en la casa de sus padres que es propia y está construida de cemento y ladrillo con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera de ingeniería de sistemas, se prepara para diseñar, programar, y mantener los sistemas de cualquier institución. Él cuenta con la capacidad de razonamiento, tiene habilidad para captar relaciones espaciales, es muy organizado, presta mucha atención y concentración, le gustan las operaciones de cálculo y tiene mucha imaginación creadora, habilidad para el dibujo, minuciosidad y precisión en los movimientos manuales. “Todo comenzó cuando mis familiares me regalaron mi primera computadora, el cual más tarde programé. Aprendí varios lenguajes de programación, construí una batería con papel estañado, cartulina y palitos de helado, inserté unos sonidos con la instrucción sound… ensamblé las “cajas” al puerto del control y listo… ese fue el inicio…” comenta. La ventaja de su carrera es que ya se encuentra en último año para terminar, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de materiales de estudios. Su sueño es terminar su carrera y trabajar, el desea realizar el pago de las ultimas materias del año para concluir su carrera. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que estudia.
Es por esos motivos que Daniel solicita un préstamo para pagar las últimas materias de su carrera para terminarla y dedicarse a trabajar.
texts.en:
Daniel is a 27 year old man, is single and without kids. He studies career systems engineering.

He is intelligent, cheerful, happy, helpful, friendly, committed to his studies and very responsible. He studies courses in a private university located in the area of "Achachicala" which is one of the most traditional neighborhoods in the city. His name comes from large rocks found at the city from the pre-Hispanic period, stones the villagers attribute to have magical and hypnotic powers, and have been the stuff of legend. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 8-18 degrees Celsius.

Daniel is of dark complexion, with dark hair that he keeps short, brown eyes, and short stature. His maternal language is Aymará which he does not speak anymore and he speaks Spanish in general culture and for the studies that he does. His life takes place in the home of his parents which is their own and is constructed of cement and brick with a tin roof and has potable water, electric energy, domestic gas and sewage. He is studying computer engineering, and is prepared to design, develop and maintain systems of any institution. He has the ability to reason, has ability to capture spatial relationships, is very organized, pays close attention and concentration, he likes arithmetic and has much creative imagination, drawing skills, thoroughness and accuracy of manual movements. "It all started when my family gave me my first computer, which I later programmed. I learned various programming languages, I constructed a battery with tinned paper, cardboard and popsicle sticks. I joined the 'boxes' to the control part and ready...that was the beginning" he says. The advantage of his career is that he is in the last year to finish, the disadvantage is the lack of money to purchase study materials. His dream is to finish his career and to work, the desire to pay from last year to conclude matters of his career. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 4 years he has studied.

It is for these reasons that Daniel is requesting a loan to pay for the last materials of his career to finish it and take jobs.

loans.use: to pay for the last materials of his career to finish it and take jobs.

loans.name: María Elicita

texts.es:
EL en la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Blanco. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente que son muy visitadas por sus playas y su rica y variada gastronomía.
Aquí vive la señora María, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 21, 19, 17, 12 y 6  años de edad, los tres menores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido agricultor. 
Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que hay en el hogar, ella tiene una tienda de víveres, lugar en el cual trabajan junto a su marido aunque en ocasiones le toca trabajar a ella sola ya que su marido también se dedica a la agricultura y es para esto para lo cual están solicitando el crédito ya que él tiene  varias hectáreas en las cuales ha sembrado  arroz y espera con el crédito poder fumigar las plagas y  poner el fertilizante adecuado para obtener una muy buena cosecha.
Este crédito es para comprar insecticidas, abono para  los cultivos y ciertos víveres que necesita en su tienda. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ellos salen adelante razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución y con las personas que le ayudan con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa del Blanco credit group meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its traditional culture and also for being just minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province—San Jacinto and San Clemente.  They are frequently visited for their beaches and their rich and varied food culture.

María lives in this area.  She is 39 years old and is in a common-law relationship.  She has five children, ages 6, 12, 17, 19, and 21, from that relationship.  The three youngest are in elementary school and high school.  Her partner is a farmer.

María is a very determined woman who likes to work in order to help her partner with the expenses of the home.  She has a grocery store where she works alongside her partner, although occasionally she works alone because her partner also works in farming.  It is because of this that they are asking for a loan, because he has several hectares where he has sown rice.  He hopes to be able to fumigate the infestations and apply adequate fertilizer in order to get a really good harvest.

This loan is to buy insecticides and fertilizers for the plants and certain supplies that she needs in her store.  She is a founding member of this credit group.  She likes it because thanks to the loans they are getting ahead.  This is why she is very grateful to the institution and to the people who help her through these loans.  Her dream is to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and supplies

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is a 52-year-old married woman.  She has seven children. 

Maxima is in the agricultural business of seaweed production in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Maxima has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maxima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Marecel

texts.en:
Marecel is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marecel has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Marecel has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marecel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine and her daughter are very thankful for their first Kiva loan and support and they hope for one more. Hermine lives with her husband and beautiful daughter in Sevan, a city in the Gharkunik region. She is a pedagogue and at this moment she works at the school. Her husband is also employed and together they do their best to manage to support the whole family and also pay their daughter’s education costs. She studies Economics at Yerevan State University, with the faculty of Accountancy and Audit at the paid division.
 
Hermine says that all her family will be so pleased if Kiva lenders support them for the second time. She needs the loan in order to pay her daughter’s tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fee

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a 30-year-old married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Margie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other tools needed for her business.

Margie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and  other tools needed for her business

loans.name: Reina Azucena

texts.es:
Reina es una mujer casada de 31 años de edad, tiene tres hijos de las edades entre dos y ocho años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Reina para generar sus ingresos  y apoyar a su familia trabaja en oficios domésticos desde hace siete años,  ella cuenta que gracias a esta labor ha sacado adelante a la familia.
Reina ahora ha decidido remodelar su casa, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar cemento, arena, hierro y piedrín y realizar la remodelación por tal motivo solicita un crédito.
Reina sueña con seguir mejorando su casa y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Reina is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 3 children between the ages of 2 and 8. They live in the community of Sololá. In order to generate income and support her family, Reina has been a domestic employee for 7 years. She says that thanks to this work, she has gotten her family ahead.

Reina has decided to remodel her house, but one of the difficulties she has is not having enough money to buy cement, sand, iron, and gravel to do the remodeling. For this reason, she is requesting a loan. Reina dreams of further improving her house and of her children becoming professionals.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and gravel to remodel her house.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
EL en la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Blanco. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente que son muy visitadas por sus playas y su rica y variada gastronomía.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 15, 13, 9 y 1 años de edad, los tres mayores estudian dos en colegio y uno en escuela. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
Doña María es una  mujer que siempre le ha gustado sentirse independiente y trabajar para bien de su familia, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días a visitar a sus clientes frecuentes a quienes les  deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, para ella esto es una ventaja ya que los visita para cobrar y nuevamente les vende. Lleva más de 1 año dedicada a sus ventas con la cual se gana algo que lo invierte en la educación de sus hijas lo cual para ella es lo más importante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas, entre otras prendas que vende. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que  sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The “Santa Rosa Del Blanco” group meets every fortnight in the city of Charapoto. This area is known for its traditional culture. It is also a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, which are San Jacinto and San Clemente. The area is frequented for its beaches and its rich and varied cuisine.

Maria lives in this place. She is 32 years old and is in a common-law marriage, from which she has four children, aged 15, 13, 9, and 1. The three eldest are studying: two are in high school, and one at school. Her husband makes a living by fishing.

Maria is a woman who has always liked to be independent and work for the wellbeing of her family. She makes a living from trade. She sells all different types of clothes from door to door. She goes out nearly every day to visit her regular clients, to whom she sells on credit. She collects payment every eight days. This is an advantage for her since she visits them to collect payment and then sells them something more.

She has been doing this for more than a year and she earns some money from it to invest in the education of her daughters, which is the most important thing for her.

She is going to use this loan to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and other items of clothing to sell. She has been with the group for two loan cycles and she likes it because the loans help her.

Her dream is for her children to have a good education.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and other items of clothing

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y tres nietos, es una señora que cumple con sus funciones de ama de casa, abuela responsable y además genera ingresos para solventar algunos gastos familiares, tiene su puesto de venta de carne de res y cerdo en el mercado municipal, trabaja todos los días de 8:00 a.m. a 1:30 p.m. desde aproximadamente 15 años, ella compra las reses y los cerdos para posteriormente destazarlos.
Necesita el crédito para comprar una res y dos cerdos para mantener su negocio funcionado y cubriendo las demandas de sus clientes, espera que la inversión sea de mucha ayuda para mejorar su situación financiera y resarcir su deuda.
El mayor sueño de la Sra. Rosa es adquirir conocimiento en el uso de créditos para tener un negocio más rentable y una vida más confortable junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and 3 grandchildren. She is a woman who fulfills her roles as a homemaker and a responsible grandmother. She also generates income to cover some of the household expenses. Rosa has a stand where she sells beef and pork at the municipal market. She works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. For about 15 years, she has been buying cows and pigs to butcher them later on.

Rosa needs this loan to buy a cow and 2 pigs to keep her business running and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes the investment will be of much help to improve her financial situation and repay her debt. Rosa's biggest dream is to obtain knowledge about the use of loans in order to have a more profitable business and a more comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow and 2 pigs to keep her business running and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael es un hombre de 35 años de edad, que cuenta que antes de tener acceso al crédito, el cultivaba en poco cantidad  pero gracias al crédito su cultivo ha mejorado, y con ello sus ingresos, por lo que se encuentra muy agradecido, él ahora solicita nuevamente un  préstamo  que lo utilizara para comprar sus fertilizantes porque tiene una parte de su cultivo que necesita de su fertilizantes para poder producir una buena cosecha.
Rafael tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente el crédito  para que su vida siga prosperando.
texts.en:
Rafael is a 35-year-old man. He says that before he had access to loans, he only grew crops in small quantities, but now his crops, along with his income, has improved thanks to the loan. For this reason, he is very grateful. Now he is requesting another loan, which he will use to buy fertilisers because some of his crops need fertilisers in order to be able to produce a good harvest.

Rafael hopes to obtain another loan so that he can continue to prosper in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers to maintain his crops

loans.name: Francisca Jaqueline

texts.es:
EL en la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Blanco. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente que son muy visitadas por sus playas y su rica y variada gastronomía.
En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Francisca es una mujer que le gusta a base de esfuerzo salir adelante y con los créditos ayudarle a su marido con sus actividades, ella divide el crédito para ella y su marido, el tiene cultivos de maíz y arroz, el en esta época de invierno es cuando más hectáreas siembra razón  por lo cual necesitan del crédito pues las  plagas están dañando los cultivos y necesitan de insecticidas para poder contrarrestar esta plaga y así tener una buena cosecha, ella también  se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa por catalogo lo cual lo realiza en sus momentos desocupados.
Este crédito es para comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes y ropa para sus ventas. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución y con las personas que contribuyen para sus créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa del Blanco credit group meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This area is known for its traditional culture and also for being just minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province—San Jacinto and San Clemente.  They are frequently visited for their beaches and their rich and varied food culture.

This is were Francisca lives.  She is 42 years old and is married.  She has two children from her relationship, ages 6 and 11.  Both of the children are in school.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Francisca is a woman who likes to get ahead through her efforts.  Through her loans, she likes to help her husband in his work.  She is dividing this loan between herself and her husband.  He has plantings of corn and rice; during this winter season is when he will sow more hectares, so they need the loan because of the infestations that are damaging the plants.  They need insecticides to be able to counteract this infestation and thus get a good harvest.  She also works in trade, selling clothing by catalog.  She does this in her free moments.

This loan is to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and clothing for her sales.  She has been in the credit group for three years, and she likes it because of the help that they give along with the loans.  She is very grateful to the institution and to the people who contribute to her loans.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and clothes

loans.name: María Natividad

texts.es:
EL en la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Blanco. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente que son muy visitadas por sus playas y su rica y variada gastronomía.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 56 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
Doña María es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a  su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, él se dedica tanto a la pesca como también a la agricultura, tiene cultivos de arroz, el aprovecha la época invernal para sembrar mas hectáreas y así al obtener sus producción sacar buenas ganancias para no tener problemas económicos, actualmente necesita fumigar las plagas y abonar para que los cultivos tengan una mejor producción.
Este crédito es para fertilizantes  e insecticidas para los cultivos. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudar a la dura carga del hogar. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days the Grupo De Credito Santa Rosa Del Blanco meets in the city of Charapoto.  This locality is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.  It is a very visited area due to its beaches and its rich and varied gastronomy.

Senora Maria lives in this place.  She is 56 years old and in a common-law relationship from which she has six adult children, two of whom still live in her house.  Her husband is a fisherman.

Maria is a very good wife who, to help her husband, is asking for a loan for him to use in his work.  He works both in fishing and in agriculture. He has rice crops.  He takes advantage of the winter season to seed more hectares. In order to continue obtaining a good income and to not have economic problems, he now needs to fumigate the pests and fertilize in order that his crops have improved production.

This loan is for fertilizers and insecticides for the crops.  Maria has been five cycles with the Grupo De Credito and she likes it because in this way she can help in the hard burden of maintaining the home.  Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Artashes

texts.en:
This young man’s name is Artashes and he is 23 years old.  He lives with his parents, brother and school-aged sister in Kapan, a city in the Syunik region of Armenia.

Artashes has a vocational education; he is an accountant, but having never managed to find a job in his area of specialty, Artashes decided to become a farmer.  He also does construction work by order in his city.  Artashes mentions that, thanks to his father’s valuable advice concerning farming, he became a good farmer and now he is rather skilled in that field despite his young age. He skillfully takes care of his farm animals including a cow, goats and piglets. His mother makes very tasty cheese from goat’s milk, and the sale of pork brings small but steady income to his big family.

Artashes is requesting this loan so he can buy fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is a hardworking woman who is married and has three children. She was born in a small village in the northern part of Tajikistan. Muhabbat’s husband is an electrician. She started an agricultural business and cultivates tomatoes and rice. With income from her harvest, Muhabbat bought calves. Each year, she tries to expand her business through buying cattle and increasing the size of her land.

Muhabbat is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer and expand her farm. She awaits your mercy and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is 30 years old and lives happily with her beloved husband and two pretty daughters in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region. Her husband works as a fireman. Nelli is a historian with a higher education, but regretfully, she mentions that she has never managed to work in her specialty. Currently, she works as a computer operator in a private company. Nelli feels great lack of knowledge about the computer program she uses at work and she only has a short period of time to learn it and not lose her job. 

Nelli is requesting a loan to pay for training courses to learn the computer program that she needs to use at work.

loans.use: to pay for and enroll in computer training programs for her work

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 55 years old, is married and has one child, who is in school. 

Merlinda is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Merlinda has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed sixteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ena Margarita

texts.es:
El en la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Blanco. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente que son muy visitadas por sus playas y su rica y variada gastronomía.
En este lugar vive la señora Ena, tiene 58 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes. El marido es comerciante.
Doña Ena es una mujer que el igual que su marido les gusta trabajar para salir adelante, ellos  se dedican  a la compra y venta de camarón,  su esposo compra el camarón en las lanchas y barcos que llegan a las playas cercanas para luego en su carro salir los dos a vender por libras o al por mayor por la ciudad y restaurantes,  llevan más de 15 años con este negocio el cual les ha permitido salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar camarón para sus ventas. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ellos salen adelante. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando junto a su  esposo.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days the Grupo De Credito Santa Rosa Del Blanco meets in the city of Charapoto.  This locality is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.  It is a very visited area due to its beaches and its rich and varied gastronomy.

Senora Ena lives in this place.  She is 58 years old and is in a common-law relationship from which she has two adult children who live independently.  Her husband is a businessman.  Ena is a woman who, just as her husband, likes to work in order to move forward.

They work buying and selling shrimp.  Her husband buys the shrimp from the launches and boats that arrive at the nearby beaches and then the two of them leave in their car for the city and restaurants to sell the shrimp by the pound or wholesale.  They have been doing this business for more than 15 years and it has permitted them to get ahead.

This loan is going to be used to buy shrimp for their sales.  Ena has been in the Grupo De Credito for two years and she likes it because in this way they can move forward.  Her dream is to continue working together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy shrimp

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda is 46 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. For the past two years, she has been a rice farmer in the Philippines. Medarda has borrowed three previous loans from NWTF to sustain her farm.

Medarda is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 62 years old and married with six children. For the past year, she has been a seaweed farmer in the Philippines. Mercedes has borrowed one previous loan from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Mercedes is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy farm supplies for her seaweed farm. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her seaweed farm

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella was born in the village Aghavnavank in the Tavush region. She is married and still lives in the same village. Stella has a son, who is a student, and a school-aged daughter. She is a farmer who works with her husband on their established farm to earn an income for their family. At her farm, Stella has cows, pigs, piglets, chickens, and a horse. She is good housewife and she makes very tasty cheese and butter and also sells milk, meat, and eggs. She and her husband cultivate potatoes and greens to sell and use for food. Stella’s husband also transports passengers throughout their region in his truck. Together, they try to make ends meet and cover the expenses for their household and their children’s education. 

Stella is requesting a loan to start beekeeping at her farm. This will provide a new source of income for the farm as well as provide a new interest and experience. She will buy several bee families and also some fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy several bee families and fodder for her  cattle

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna lives and manages her business in Ijevan, a city in the Taush region. She lives with her son and daughter there, both of whom are already students. Starting in 2009 until today, Anna has been selling food and household goods in her own small market. All of the products that she has in her market are of every day and first need for families. All of the customers around the city very quickly became her regular customers. Anna buys all of the products for her market from local distributors, and she also goes to Yerevan to buy some products. In her business, Anna’s daughter greatly helps her and thanks to this business, Anna has perfectly taken care of her children for many years and pays for their education. She needs this loan now in order to refresh her market's assortment with some new types of sweets and some household goods that she did not have before for sale in her market.

loans.use: to refresh her market's assortment with some new types of sweets and some household goods

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 47 years old, is married and has six children, four of whom are in school. 

Monica is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Monica requested a loan of 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Monica has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Monica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гулзат, 35 лет, замужем, есть 3 дочери. На протяжении 10 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. У нее в хозяйстве есть корова, молоко которой Гулзат продает на ежедневной основе. На 0,50 Га арендованной и 0,60 Га собственной земли выращивает картофель и люцерну для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзат решила обратиться в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Гулзат является одним из трех участников группы "Келечек". Свои доходы она планирует вкладывать в увеличение поголовья скота и строительство дома.
texts.en: Gulzat is 35 years old, married and has 3 daughters. She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming. She has a cow, whose milk Gulzat sells daily. She grows potatoes and alfalfa for sale and farm use on 0.50 hectares of leased and 0.60 hectares of own land. To continue developing her business, Gulzat decided to request a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy bulls for fattening up and sale. Gulzat is one of the three members of the Kelechek group. She plans to invest her earnings into increasing her livestock headcount and building a house.

loans.use: to buy bulls for fattening up and sale

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es:
Nicolás  un hombre de 48 años de edad, cuenta que antes de acceder al crédito el cultivaba en poca cantidad, pero el crédito le cambio la vida porque su cultivo ahora ha incrementado y con ello sus ingresos,  él se encuentra profundamente agradecido por el apoyo brindado, pero este humilde hombre ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo que lo utilizara para terminar la construcción de su casa, comprando con ello cemento, cal, arena y piedrín.
Nicolás tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente el crédito y seguir mejorando sus  condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nicolás, age 48, says that before he got the loan he grew in small amounts.  However, the loan changed his life. His crops have now increased, and with this his income has increased.  He is profoundly grateful for the support provided.

However, this humble man is now requesting a new loan to finish building his house.  He will use the loan to buy cement, lime powder, sand, and gravel.

Nicolás hopes to get a loan once again and to continue improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime powder, sand, and gravel to remodel his house.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.pt:
Mãe viúva de 3 filhos de 21,16 e 10 anos de idade e vivendo apenas com 2, todos a estudarem e cuida de 1 neto que sua filha teve na adolescência. Tem 41 anos de idade, tem 7ª classe, vive na casa própria à base de negocio. Este é  4º empréstimo e sempre investiu no negocio. Com o ultimo iniciou a reabilitação da sua casa que se encontra num estado degradado
Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar amendoim, óleo, feijão, verduras para reforçar o seu negocio que faz em Ressano nas terças e sextas feiras e o resto dos dias no mercado da Moamba.
Ela tem a esperança de poder continuar a garantir a escola dos seus filhos, para que eles se formem e tenham emprego bem como continuar a construção/reabilitação de sua casa. 
O seu maior desafio é trabalhar para ter rendimentos suficientes para realizar as despesas ja que não tem com quem partilhar as despesas e nem sempre o negocio lhe sai como ela deseja.
texts.en:
Delfina is a widowed mother of three children aged 21, 16 and 10. All her children study, and only two of them live with her. She takes care of a grandson that her daughter bore as a teenager. She's 41 years old and studied up to the 7th grade. She lives in a house that she owns, and she earns a livelihood through her business. This is her 4th loan and they have always gone towards her business. With the last loan she started repairing her house which is in bad shape.
With the current loan she intends to purchase peanuts, cooking oil, beans and vegetables to stock her business. She does business in Ressano on Tuesdays and Fridays and at the Moamba market on the remaining days.
She hopes to be able to continue providing her children with an education so that they can get a degree and become employed. She also hopes to continue building/repairing her house.
Her biggest challenge is working so she can turn enough of a profit to afford her expenses, since she doesn't have anyone to split expenses with and the business doesn't always turn out the way she hoped it would.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, cooking oil, beans and vegetables to stock her business.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en: Hamlet is a farmer from the frontier city of Ijevan in the Tavush region. He lives there with his nice wife and two school-aged children. His wife is a saleswoman at the market, but she is also engaged in farming and agriculture with Hamlet. Hamlet also takes some orders related to house repair and other construction work, but farming is in first place for him. He is already a master in swine breeding and poultry. He has chickens, a lot of pigs and piglets, which makes him very famous as his farm’s meat (pork and poultry) is of high quality and always fresh and tasty. His customers are city butchers and also his neighbors and friends. Hamlet also sells his land’s potato, mainly wholesale to resellers.  Hamlet decided to have his first deal with Kiva as he wants to enlarge his farm and with this loan he wants to buy several piglets. He greatly hopes that this partnership will bring a lot of success and profit for his family.

loans.use: to enlarge his farm and buy several piglets

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en:
Alasgar is a farmer who is married with two children. One of his children is 25 years old and married and the other is studying at university. Alasgar and his family are internally displaced persons (IDP) from Fuzuli city who are presently living in the Fuzuli region. For the past 15 years, Alasgar has been a farmer who raises cows.

Alasgar is requesting a 1,000 AZN loan to repair the roof of his barn. He says a great thanks to Kiva lenders.  In the future, Alasgar wants to be able to help his son get married.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his barn

loans.name: Erika Alexandra

texts.es:
En el  Cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Las Pampas, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Erika, tiene  26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9 y 4  años, ambos estudian en una escuela de la localidad. El marido es artesano.
Doña Erika es una mujer muy activa que le gusta generar sus propios ingresos y de esta forma ir mejorando su calidad de vida, ella tiene una tienda de víveres la misma que comenzó gracias  a los créditos que recibió de la institución y también a las personas que hicieron posible que recibiera su crédito, así de a poco fue mejorando su negocio el cual actualmente lo tiene muy bien surtido y le permite ganarse la vida, ella también ahí mismo e sus ratos desocupados teje sombreros de paja toquilla, los mismos que al venderlos le deja muy buenos ingresos extra que les sirve para darles a sus hijos y familia una vida estable. 
Este crédito es para comprar más variedad de víveres para seguir brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella ha podido ir mejorando su vida y los de su familia Sus sueños son. darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Las Pampas communal bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi canton.  It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are well-known on a national and international level.  It is the place of the famous straw hats.
