Thus she will be able to generate direct employment and in addition she will be able to offer better service, since the customers will be more comfortable, which will help her to improve her sales and the income that she receives.

Gloria, with her perseverance and projection for the future, wants to expand her beauty salon, where she could generate more employment opportunities for mothers who are the heads of their families, giving as a result better well-being not only for her family but also supporting other people so that they can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the various tools and supplies wholesale (hair treatments, dyes, shampoo, and conditioner, among other items)

loans.name: Evelin Yadira

texts.es: A sus 19 años de edad Yadira  esta casada, el esposo de Yadira trabaja de obrero en una planta florícola, Yadira se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores y en este caso  el crédito  lo a invertir en la compra de chanchos, Yadira aspira comprar mas chanchos y asi mejorar su negocio, para que este le permita mejorar la calidad de  vida de su hijo.
texts.en: At nineteen, Yadira is married. Her husband is a worker in a flower-growing plant. Yadira raises young animals, and in this case her loan will be invested in buying pigs. Yadira hopes to buy more pigs to improve her business, and thus provide a better quality of life for her son.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Leonardo es que su hogar puede tener una vida digna.
El prepara y vende jugos naturales en el municipio de Medellín, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Sus padres son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.

Trabaja solo durante 7 horas todos los días.
El espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra insumos y materia prima como frutas y reparación de su carro de jugos, este impulso se lo pueden dar la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.

Con estos elementos él podrá tener sus bebidas disponibles para sus clientes en todo momento.

Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Thanks to Leonardo’s perseverance and courage, life in his home is dignified. He prepares and sells natural juice in the municipality of Medellín, work that he took on when attempting to find new sources of income to support his family.

His parents are his biggest motivation to work daily and make the effort to improve himself more each day.

He works alone for seven hours a day. He hopes to be able to improve his business by buying supplies and raw materials such as fruits, and to repair his juice cart. This impulse can be supported by Corporación Interactuar and the Kiva lenders.

With these elements in place he can have his drinks ready for customers all of the time. His biggest dream is to be able to improve conditions in his home.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw materials such as fruit and to repair his juice cart.

loans.name: Rosa Edilma

texts.es:
El en la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Santa Rosa Del Blanco. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente que son muy visitadas por sus playas y su rica y variada gastronomía.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 59 años de edad, está separada pero de ese relación tiene siete hijos mayores de edad, una hija vive con ella y un pequeño nieto que tiene 7 años y estudia en escuela. 
Doña Rosa con la intención de ganarse la vida  y con esto poder salir adelante se dedica al comercio, vende ropa nueva o usada de acuerdo a lo que sus clientes prefieran así como también frutas y legumbres. Ella vende en su casa y también recorre la ciudad, que a pesar de que es un trabajo duro y constante ella lo realiza ya que es su forma de ganarse la vida honradamente, lleva 2 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida de ella y de los que viven en su casa.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, frutas, legumbres y verduras. Lleva 2 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para seguir en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the loan group Santa Rosa del Blanco meets every two weeks. This place is known for its traditional culture and in addition for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches of the province, namely, San Jacinto and San Clemente, which are much visited for their beaches and their rich and varied gastronomy.

Señora Rosa lives in this place. She is 59 years old. She is separated, but from this relationship she has seven adult children. One daughter lives with her, along with a little grandson who is 7 years old and goes to school.

Doña Rosa, with the intention of earning a living and with this being able to get ahead, works in commerce. She sells new or used clothing, according to what her customers prefer, and she also sells fruits and legumes. She sells in her house and she also goes through the city, which, in spite of its being hard and constant work, she does since it is her way of earning a living honorably. She has been doing this work for 2 years, and with it she earns a living for herself and for those who live in her house.

She is going to use this loan to buy clothing, fruits, legumes, and vegetables. She has been in the loan group for two loan cycles, and she likes it because of the opportunity that it gives her to grow with the loans. Her dreams are to have good health in order to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, fruits, legumes, and vegetables

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr lives in Kapan a town in the province Syunik, with his wife and 15-year-old daughter. 

For five years, Norayr has been working construction jobs. He receives orders both from his town of Kapan and from nearby regions, so Norayr must work hard to manage to cover all his orders. The family is not big, but the fact that Norayr is the only worker in the family creates many difficulties. 

To expand his work and take on more orders, Norayr asks for this loan. He plans to purchase a rotary hammer drill and materials needed for working construction jobs. Norayr has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International.The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan will help Norayr to make his work more effective. This is his first loan with Kiva lenders, and he expects good results.

loans.use: to pay for a rotary hammer drill and materials needed for working construction jobs.

loans.name: Doris Alexandra

texts.es: Doris es una joven que nació y creció en el campo y comenta que ella no se dedico a estudiar por motivo de la gran distancia que tenia para llegar a un centro educativo, Los padres de Doris le inculcaron a sus actividades de ganadería y agricultura, Doris necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca y comenta que le va bien en la venta de la leche, Doris es una joven muy alegre con su negocio y desea seguir trabajando,  Doris tiene confianza de que si va a progresar con su negocio y prepararse para el futuro.
texts.en:
Doris is a young lady, that was born and raised in the countryside. She says that she does not attend school, because of the great distance that she has to go to get to a school.

Doris's parents taught her the businesses of livestock and agriculture. Doris needs a loan to buy a cow, and she says that she does well in the sale of milk. Doris is a young lady, very happy with her business, and she wants to continue working. Doris has confidence that she is going to progress with her business, and prepare for the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra  is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband who is also shown in the photo. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community byproviding good quality products; they make enough to meet the expenses of their 6 children. 

Currently, Kubra has requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea to cater to as many  customers as possible, and to generate a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is 56 years old and she lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. She is married and she has a son and a daughter. Svetlana has a vocational medical education with the specialty of nursing. Svetlana worked in this field for many years, and even today she is engaged in a trading business of her own. She also takes orders for doing injections for her neighbors and friends. 

Now in a small space she manages the sale of fruit and vegetables: she sells apples, oranges, lemons, kiwis, and bananas, along with potatoes, greens, carrots, radishes, cabbages, etc. She buys all the products from the villagers, sometimes from re-sellers, and she always chooses fresh, tasty and not very expensive products so that her customers are always satisfied with the quality, prices and service of her market. 

Svetlana also sells honey in her market. Since her husband is a rather skilled and famous beekeeper in their city (he has 40 beehives in his farm in a nearby village), Svetlana already has a lot of customers for the honey as well. 

This loan of 350.000 Armenian drams will be used to do privatization of her stall to work there legally; she also wants to do some small repairs of her workplace.

loans.use: to do some small repairs of her work place and to pay fees for stall privatization

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 32-year-old married woman. She, along with her husband, has been working in agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Mumtaz has applied a loan of 50000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, along with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma  is a 40-year-old married woman. She is the mother of 8 children. Her husband has been doing the business of animal sales and purchase for many years. Najma  fully supports and assists her husband with his work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living through all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнара, 43 года, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Гулнары высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1999 году. Благодаря упорному труду Гулнары, на сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем до 9,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 30 овец, также на участке мерою 2,0 Га собственной поливной земли, она выращивает фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулнара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец, часть средств будет потрачена на покупку удобрений и топлива для полеводства. Доходы от кредита Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы накопить на строительство дома для сына.
texts.en: Gulnara is 43 years old, married, and she has three children.  She has a college education.  Since 1999, she has been raising livestock and growing crops, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently makes an average monthly income of up to 9,000 som (KGS).  She has two cows and 30 sheep on her farm, and she also grows beans for sale on two hectares of her own irrigated land.  In order to further grow her business, Gulnara has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to purchase ten sheep.  She will also use a portion of her loan to buy fertilizers and fuel for farming.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business, so that she can save some money to build a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep, fertilizers, and fuel for land cultivation.

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para compra de maíz por mayor y cal para poder continuar con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old and she lives in her own house with her two children. She makes a living selling tortillas. Her business is located in her residence. She been doing this work for 5 years; with the sales she makes, she is able to pay for some of her household expenses. 

She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale corn and lime to be able to continue with her sales and that way have better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and lime

loans.name: Armida Ruth

texts.es: Armida vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, su negocio está ubicado frente a la alcaldía municipal, tiene varios años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa la cual inicio con capital propio, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Armida lives in her own house with her three children. She makes a living selling clothes. Her business is located in front of City Hall. 

For several years, she has worked at her clothing sales, which she started with her own capital. With the sales, she has managed to overcome some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale clothes, to be able to continue with her sales, and to be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Liliana Del Rosari

texts.es: La señora Liliana es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos de  las edades de 5, 8, 10 y 13 años de edad, todos sus hijos están estudiando, aunque con algunas limitaciones en sus gastos pero Liliana saca adelante a sus hijos, Liliana se dedica a  la ganadería, crianza de animales menores y también trabaja al jornal de trabajos del campo, Liliana necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar terneros,  mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Liliana is a single mother. She has 4 children, ages 5, 8, 10, and 13. All her children are in school. Liliana is bringing up her children, although with some limitations in her spending. 

Liliana makes a living in livestock, raising small animals, as well as earning wages from field labor. Liliana needs the loan money to buy calves, to improve her business, and thus her income, for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Ana Delmis

texts.es: Ana de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 3 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra salir adelante con su familia, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Ana is 39 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. She has worked tailoring clothes for the last three years. Her sewing shop is located in her house, and she has many clients  who come for the quality of her clothing. With her earnings, she has been able to support her family. Ana is asking for a loan to buy threads, needles, a variety of fabrics, buttons, elastics, etc., and be able to continue with her work to generate good earnings.

loans.use: To buy threads, needles, variety of fabrics, buttons, elastics,etc.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos es carpintero desde hace 20 años, pues aprendió esta actividad por tradicion de su padre propietario de un taller de muebles, donde creció viendo cortes, cepillados ensamblaje de articulos como mesas, puertas etc. Su trabajo lo realiza mediante pedidos que hacen sus clientes, para quienes diseña el producto y posteriormente a su aceptación lo elabora y se lo vende a crédito.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiemito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comrpará madera e inusmos de herrería, para elaborar puertas, mesas entre otros articulos. Con esta inversión, podrá adquirir las materias primas que requiere para responder a nuevos pedidos y su productividad se incrementará, logrando el éxito de esta inversión.  Su meta mas adelante es ampliar la apariencia de su taller y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, aunque su principal desafio sea el insficiente capital para lograrlo, aun así trabajará consistentemente y poco a poco llegar a su propósito.
texts.en:
Carlos has been a carpenter for 20 years. He learned the trade by following in the tradition of his father, who owned a furniture workshop. There Carlos learned how to saw and assemble lumber to make tables, doors, and other pieces. His work comes from orders that he receives from his customers. Carlos designs the piece and once the customer grants approval on the finished product, it is sold on credit.

He is now applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Carlos will use the money to buy wood and blacksmith supplies for making door, tables, and other pieces. With this investment, he will acquire the raw materials that he needs to complete new orders and increase his productivity. As a result, this investment will be a success. Going forward, his goals are to expand the appearance of his workshop and improve his family’s quality of life. The main challenge that will keep him from reaching his goals is insufficient capital, but he will work consistently so that he can gradually overcome this obstacle.

loans.use: to buy wood and blacksmith supplies.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a happily married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

Robina is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulties in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time, to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Bushara

texts.en:
Bushara is a 42-year-old woman. She has three children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, colors and designs from the market, at wholesale rates, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Bushara expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is an electrician with four years of experience working in Kapan town. He lives with his wife and two little kids, and is the only breadwinner in his family so he works hard to sustain them. 

Andranik provides high quality work so his work is in demand every month. He has now applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials needed to provide electrician services. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

In the future he expects good results from his business. This is his first deal with Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for his services as an electrician

loans.name: Maa Dhareni Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Hingula, standing on the right in the photo, is the featured borrower of Maa Dhareni SHG-A, a Group hailing from Koraput district, Odisha and Daimati is the second member of this group. They run small-scale businesses of their own to supplement their household income. Hard working and determined, these ladies work day and night to meet their daily needs, however insufficient raw materials resulting from insufficient working capital prevents them from expanding their business and providing for their children’s future.

Therefore, the group members passed a resolution in their weekly meeting for a group loan of 36,000 INR at the rate of 18,000 INR per member to expand their business. With this loan Hingula will purchase tables, chairs, kitchen equipment and more plates and glasses in order to expand her tea stall. With your loan, these women will be able to expand their business capacity, serving more customers and in turn, increase their earning potential. Your loan will ensure that these ladies' efforts do not go in vain and they will lead more financially secure lives.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs, kitchen equipment and more plates and glasses in order to expand her tea stall

loans.name: Manegre 12 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr KOUDOUGOU MADI  est responsable du groupe  MANEGRE 12 SAPONE. Il est marié sans enfant  et il a 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait de l’élevage depuis 15 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 03 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne  construire.
texts.en:
Mr. KOUDOUGOU MADI is the official of the group MANEGRE 12 SAPONE. He is married and has no children. He has four persons to support.

Mr. KOUDOUGOU MADI has been raising livestock for 15 years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. With the money granted, he intends to purchase three sheep. He wants to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to build [a house].

loans.use: to purchase 3 sheep

loans.name: Manegre 11 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
MR TANKOUDOUGOU ELIE  est responsable du groupe  MANEGRE 11 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans.  03 enfants  vont  à l’école  et il a 08 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait de l’élevage depuis 23 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 03 porcs.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne assurer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. TANKOUDOUGOU ELIE is the official of the group MANEGRE 11 SAPONE. He is a married father of five children. The oldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is 3. Three go to school, and he has eight persons to support.

Mr. TANKOUDOUGOU ELIE has been raising livestock for 23 years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. With the money granted, he intends to purchase three pigs. He wants to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to ensure his children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs

loans.name: Manegre 10 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr MOUSSA est responsable du groupe  MANEGRE 10 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 10 enfants. Le plus âgé a 40 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans.  04 enfants  vont  à l’école  et il a 20 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait de l’élevage depuis 03 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 03 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne assurer l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. MOUSSA is the official of the group MANEGRE 10 SAPONE. He is a married father of ten children. The oldest is 40, and the youngest is 5. Four children go to school. He has twenty persons to support.

Mr. MOUSSA has been raising livestock for three years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. With the money granted, he intends to purchase three sheep. He wants to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to ensure his children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sheep

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 53 years old and married. She has been doing a business of bangles sales for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family needs. Therefore, she started her own business to contribute to the family income.  Naseem has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate a healthier source of income. She has a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales

loans.name: Maa Dhareni Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Malati, standing left in the photo, is from a small village in Koraput District in Odisha. She is 49 years old and supplements her husband’s income by working on the farms as a daily wage laborer. But their combined income of 8,500 INR a month is still very low and they find it difficult to make ends meet. Malati is looking to increase her monthly income by setting up a small enterprise making and selling Leaf Plates. She will need to undergo a two- day training program to get trained in making Leaf Plates, after which she will buy the raw materials required.

She has formed a group with Bimala who is also from the same village and works as a daily laborer in the fields to supplement her family income. Both want to attend the training for making Leaf Plates. Both will then buy the required raw materials and set up their micro enterprise. They seek a loan of 36,000 INR to start their small-scale manufacturing businesses and with their current savings pattern, they expect an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy a leaf plate making machine and tools

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 45-year-old married woman. 

The man shown in the photo is Suriya’s husband, who is a driver by profession and who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning. 

For this reason, Suriya has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants  to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. 

Suriya is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts

loans.name: Maa Dhareni Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Kuni, standing on the right in the photo, is a 26-year-old married woman hailing from Koraput district in Odisha. In order to supplement her husband's income, she started her business selling fish. She buys her stock at low rates and then sells them in the neighborhood. At present, she is able to save a meager sum of 3,000 INR. In order to live a better quality of life and to save for emergencies, she intends to expand her business so that it can bring a fixed monthly income.

Kuni sells dry and fresh fish. She has formed a group along with a women namely Mangaladei. They have come together to crowd source a loan of 36,000 INR in order to expand their respective micro businesses of fish selling and tailoring. Your loan will help them expand their business and contribute to their monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk direct from the pond owner

loans.name: Maa Dhareni Shg-B Group

texts.en:
All these years, Fulama, standing left in the photo, has played the role of a wife, a mother, a homemaker and a businesswoman with remarkable diligence. She belongs to a poor family in Koraput district, Odisha, with her husband being the main earner in her family. The family's monthly income is just 6,000 INR. Even with the booming growth in the economy, her husband’s income is not enough to cover all the household costs. Her dream of educating her only child also depends on her being able to generate additional income. Thus, she has started her own business selling vegetables. She now wants to expand her business and increase the family income.

Thus, Fulama has formed a group with Kamala called ‘Maa Dhareni Shg-B’. Both are involved in the business of selling vegetables. Together they are seeking a loan of 36,000 INR, which they hope to use for stocking more vegetables and generating more revenue. The additional income will not only be used to fulfill the household requirements but will also be invested further into their businesses.

loans.use: to stock more vegetables and generate more revenue

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 46-year-old, hardworking woman who has 5 children. 

She provides a service stitching clothes in her locality, and she is popular because of her skills in stitching. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Ishrat ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. 

Now she has requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 PKR which she intends to use to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces. This will allow her to meet the demands of her customers consistently. 

She aspires to save money for a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces, so she can meet the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Alex Manuel

texts.es: Manuel es un joven de 21 años de edad, el no ha podido terminar sus estudios secundarios por motivo de falta de recursos económicos, Manuel se dedica a la venta de comida en una parada de buses y comenta que ahí se sube en esos transportes y ofrece fritadas, choclos con queso, aguas y demás, Manuel desea por lo menos llegar a ser bachiller y por este  motivo está estudiando a distancia, Manuel  va  a invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de alimentos para preparar, lo que Manuel aspira es mejorar su negocio y de allí de las ganancias  seguir adelante en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Manuel is a young man who is 21 years of age. He did not finish his secondary education due to a lack of financial resources.

Manuel sells food at a bus stop and says that he goes aboard the vehicles in order to sell fried snacks, corn on the cob with cheese, water, and other items. He at least wants to finish high school, so he has enrolled in distance learning.

Manuel will invest the money from his loan in the purchase of ingredients for preparing food. He aspires to improve his business and use his earnings to move forward with his studies.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es:
Lucero una joven de veintiocho años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Lucero para apoyar a sus padres cuenta con una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes, ella recién empezó este negocio pues se dio cuenta que en su comunidad  no hay una tienda que ofrezca  una variedad de productos,  entonces ella ahora necesita de más capital para darle a la clientela un mejor servicio, pero una delas dificultades que ella tiene es no contar con el capital suficiente para comprar productos de abarrotería como  jugos, azúcar, recitos, pastas de fideos, frijoles para surtir la tienda por tal razón solicita un prestamo de Q 5,000.00 para realizar la inversión.

El gran anhelo de lucero es tener una tienda grande, para mejorar sus ingresos y comprar su terreno para luego construir su casa.
texts.en:
Lucero is a young woman who is 28 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the community of Sololá.

Lucero helps her parents by managing a small store where she buys and sells groceries. She started this business because she realized that there are no other stores in her community that offer a variety of products. Now she needs more capital so that she can provide better service to her customers. One of her difficulties is the lack of sufficient capital for buying grocery products such as juices, sugar, snack foods, pasta, and beans. In order to invest in her store, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 GTQ.

Lucero’s greatest wish is to have a large store so that she can improve her earnings and buy a plot of land where she can build a house.

loans.use: to buy juices, sugar, snack foods, pasta, and beans to sell in her store.

loans.name: Vitali

texts.en:
Vitali is a distributor working in a local company in Kapan town. Besides his work, he drives a taxi in the evenings, using his own car. He works until nighttime to earn income and support his wife. 

The requested loan is important for this young taxi driver to pay for the car which he drives as a taxi. His loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Vitali hopes to receive lenders' support and trust.

loans.use: to pay for the car which he uses to provide taxi services, so he can provide for his new family

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe is involved in an auto repair service. In the small garage near his house, Vahe has been providing repair service for all types of automobiles, for two years already. He lives with his big family of seven: his parents, three children and wife. Vahe is the main breadwinner of the family, so he works day and night to earn income and sustain their living.
 
Among numerous maintenance problems in his garage, Vahe wants to solve the one that is the most urgent now -- he needs to renovate the garage and bring it to normal condition. Vahe asks for this loan to pay for renovation of the garage and to purchase tools and materials for providing auto repair work. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This is Vahe's first loan with Kiva and he hopes that the Kiva loan will bring success to his business.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the garage and purchase tools and materials for providing auto repair work and gathering income for the family

loans.name: Modesta Rosa

texts.es:
Modesta es una mujer de cincuenta y dos años de edad, tiene un negocio de pulpería en la comunidad donde vive. Ella inicio como una comerciante emprendedora; antes ya había recibido un préstamo anterior con el que compró granos básicos y surtió todo su negocio. Recibió grandes resultados, porque la clientela aumento, además las ganancias fueron muy buenas. Ella está muy agradecida y contenta por contar con grandes aliados como Kiva y MiCrédito. 
Ahora Modesta vuelve a solicitar un financiamiento de Kiva y MiCrédito, esta vez para comprar artículos de plástico, como baldes, vasos, platos, entre otros. Ella en un futuro desea ver su negocio como una distribuidora local, además de siempre contar con el impulso de créditos que le han permito crecer como comerciante.
texts.en:
Modesta is a 52-year-old woman who has a grocery business in the community where she lives. She started out as an enterprising merchant. The previous loan she received was used to buy basic grains and restock her entire business. She achieved good results because her clientele increased. In addition, her earnings were very good. Modesta is very grateful and pleased to have great allies, such as Kiva and MiCrédito.

Now Modesta is requesting another loan from Kiva and MiCrédito. This time she will buy plastic goods such as buckets, cups, plates, and other items. In the future, she would like to see her business turn into a distribution center. She would also like to have a boost from the loans so that she can grow as a merchant.

loans.use: to buy plastic goods such as buckets, cups, plates, and other items.

loans.name: Shagofta

texts.en:
Shagofta is a 33-year-old woman with 1 child. 

She is a vigorous lady, and for many years she has been running a cloth purchase-and-sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then she sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan as she expects a boost in her earnings through it. 

Shagofta plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs, which will attract more customers and help her to expand her business.

loans.name: Alba Areli

texts.es: Alba tiene 32 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee desde hace 4 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia la cual inicio con capital propio, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alba is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her partner. For 4 years now she has owned a small store located in her residence, which she started with her own money. She has many customers because of the good prices and the kindness that she has when selling. 

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more soaps, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet breads, etc. and from this be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soaps, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Asya

texts.en:
Asya thanks lenders for her first Kiva loan which helped her to buy perfume and thus diversify her business activities. 

Asya lives in the village of Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region. Her husband still manages his taxi driving activities. Asya also manages her business, which is a beauty salon which she opened 3 years ago in a rented space. She is both the owner of this salon and a hairdresser. She has a lot of customers and most of them are regular customers. Her beauty salon is very famous in their village and she is well-known, as she can do different hairstyles that are very fashionable, and she has good prices.

With this loan she wants to refresh the interior of her salon and make it more comfortable and attractive. She will also buy a new hairdryer, a lot of special combs which she uses often in her work, and also an assortment of shampoos.

loans.use: to refresh the interior of her salon, and to buy a new hairdryer, a lot of special combs, and an assortment of shampoos

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is a taxi driver from Yerevan town. He lives with his retired mother and likes his job as a taxi driver. 

Davit applied for this loan to pay for renovation of his car and bring it to normal working condition. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Davit hopes to receive lenders' support, as this work is the only source of income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his car for taxi driving

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is 32 years old and married. The man shown in the photo is Asma’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Asma has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires, tools and spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. Asma is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires, tools and spare parts for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Gulfara

texts.ru: Гульфара, 55 лет, замужем, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, 25 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Гульфары, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 2,92 ГА собственного земельного надела, где Гульфара ежегодно выращивает фасоль для реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть корова, лошадь и 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход от сельскохозяйственной деятельности составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульфара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) для покупки нетели и 10 овец с целью дальнейшего разведения и реализации. Гульфара намерена развить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи.
texts.en: Gulfara is 55 years old, married, and has a son. She has a secondary education, and has been practicing crop and animal husbandry for 25 years. Thanks to her hard work and persistence, Gulfara now has her own 2.92 hectare plot of land, where she raises beans every year for resale. She also has a cow, a horse, and 20 sheep on her farm. The monthly income from Gulfara's agricultural work amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). With the goal of further developing her farm, Gulfara has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a heifer and 10 sheep to breed and sell. Gulfara intends to develop her business, which will certainly lead to an increase in her family's capital.

loans.use: to buy one heifer and 10 sheep to breed and sell

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es: Salvadora de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madrina, ella se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, pastelitos de carnes y refrescos, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de papas, aceite, carne, verduras y demás ingredientes que necesita para poder seguir con sus ventas y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Salvadora is 34 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her step-mother. Salvadora earns a living selling chips, meat pasties, and soft drinks at her business near her home. She has many customers owing to the affordable prices. Salvadora is applying for a loan in order to buy potatoes, oil, meat, vegetables and other ingredients that she needs to continue with her sales and earn a higher living.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, oil, meat, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es: Maria de 38 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee un comedor ubicado en el mercado municipal que se encuentra cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollos, carnes, verduras, arroz, frijoles, frutas, refrescos y mas ingredientes para preparar los alimentos y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: María is 38 years old and a single mother. She lives in a house that she owns with her two children. She has a diner at the town market near to her home. María has many customers owing to the affordable prices. María uses her profits to cover some household costs. She is applying for a loan in order to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, rice, beans, fruits, soft drinks and other ingredients to prepare meals. She can thus earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, rice, beans, fruits, soft drinks and other ingredients.

loans.name: Pablo Ismael

texts.es: Pablo de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 22 años, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder continuar con sus venta y así tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: Pablo is 58 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his two children. Pablo has been making a living selling fruits and vegetables for 22 years at a business near his home. He is able to use his profits to cover some household costs. Pablo is applying for a loan in order to buy more fruits and vegetables in bulk to continue with his sales and thus earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Bartola

texts.es: Bartola de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco nietas, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tamales, posee más de 15 años de dedicarse a esa actividad el cual inicio con capital propia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como logra salir adelante con sus gatos en la casa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijoles, quesillo, chicharrón,  etc. y así poder seguir  con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Bartola is 60 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her five granddaughters. Bartola makes a living selling tamales and “pupusas” (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans). She has been doing this work for more than 15 years, having started the business with her own capital. Bartola is able to use her profits to cover some household costs. Bartola is applying for a loan in order to buy corn, beans, fresh cheese, pork scratchings and more and thus continue with her work and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, fresh cheese, pork scratchings and more.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando is 32 years old he is single and he lives with his uncle Fernado had a difficult childhood he had to work since he was very young Right now he earns some money by selling brooms as you can see in the picture Fernando is always travelling to the Peru border to obtain his products at a good prize Fernando needs a loan to buy more brooms for his business he would like to sell more cleaning products in the future He hopes you can help him because Fernando is the only one that earns some money
texts.en: Fernando is 32 years old. He is single and he lives with his uncle. Fernando had a difficult childhood and has had to work since he was very young. Right now he earns some money by selling brooms as you can see in the picture. Fernando is always travelling to the Peru border to obtain his products at a good price. Fernando needs a loan to buy more brooms for his business. He would like to sell more cleaning products in the future. He hopes you can help him because Fernando is the only one in his family that earns some money.

loans.use: to buy more brooms for his business

loans.name: Jessica Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda es una joven que  creció en el campo, donde los recursos económicos se los obtiene de la dedicación a la ganadería y de la agricultura, Fernanda vive con sus abuelitos ya que su madre la abandono desde que Fernanda  era una niña, Fernanda tiene 22 años de edad y asiste a un curso de computación, Fernanda va a  invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de terneros, y su aspiración de mejorar su negocio y seguir adelante es su vida.
texts.en:
Fernanda is a young lady who grew up in the countryside where income is earned from raising cattle and farming. Fernanda lives with her grandparents since her mother abandoned her when Fernanda was a child.

Fernanda is 22 years old and attends classes in computing. Fernanda is going to invest the money from the loan in buying calves. Her goal is to improve her business and move forward with her life.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Kalina

texts.ru: Калина, 63 года, в разводе, с ней живет ее 15 летний внук. У Калины- средне-специальное образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав более 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 9,000 сом (KGS). Сейчас она на пенсии и с удовольствием занимается хозяйством. Благодаря ее упорному труду, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 3 овцы. На 1,0 Га арендованной и 2,0 Га собственной земли она выращивает сафлор и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS) с учетом пенсии. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калина обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы с теленком для увеличение поголовья скота и удоя экологически чистого  молока. Доходы от кредита Калина планирует вложить в ремонт ее дома, она хочет установить пластиковые окна.
texts.en:
Kalina is 63 years old, divorced, and she lives with her 15-year-old grandson.  She has a specialized secondary education. As a way to provide an income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry and crop farming.  She started her activity 30 years ago when she bought her first livestock for 9,000 som (KGS).  Today, she is retired but still happily involved in farming.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has one cow and three sheep on her farm.  She also grows safflower and clover for resale on one hectare of leased land and two hectares of her own land.  She makes a monthly income of about 16,000 som (KGS), including her pension.  

In order to further grow her farming business, Kalina has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy one dairy cow and her calf in order to increase her livestock headcount and her production of organic milk.  Kalina is planning to use the earnings from her loan to repair her house and install plastic windows.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow with her calf in order to sell larger volumes of organic milk.

loans.name: Khursand

texts.ru: Хурсанд 30 летняя замужняя женщина. Она проживает в районе Джоми. У нее есть сын. Ему 4 года. Ее муж без работы. В семье только Хурсанд одна зарабатывает денег. Она талантливая и активная женщина. Хурсанд занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она занимается  этой деятельностью более   3 лет. Ей   этой деятельности нравится ежедневный доход, а также она обожает шить и кроить. Хурсанд берет кредит, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить процесс работы и приобрести много клиентов. Доход от этой деятельности обеспечивает ее семью. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет Хурсанд не потерять источник дохода.
texts.en:
Khursand is 30 years old, married, and she lives in the A. Jomi district of Tajikistan.  She has a four-year-old son.  Her husband is unemployed, so she is the only breadwinner in the family.  She is a skilled and dynamic woman who sews women's clothes.  She has been involved in this activity for more than three years.  She enjoys this work for the daily income it brings.  She also loves to design and sew clothes.

Khursand is taking a loan to buy a new sewing machine in order to improve her work and attract many customers.  With her earnings, Khursand supports her family.  The loan she is requesting will allow her to keep her source of income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and keep her source of income.

loans.name: Maria Vicita

texts.es: María tiene  38 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de 17 años, la otra de 11 años y la menor de 8 años, mismos que se encuentran estudiando,  María vive en el campo y comenta que sus ingresos los obtiene de la ganadería y que su esposo se dedica  a trabajar al jornal con su yunta, Maria tiene vacas y el dinero del crédito lo va  a invertir en la comprar de una vaca, ya que mediante  la venta de la leche es como puede cubrir los gastos del hogar y  de la educación de sus hijos y espera seguir trabajando por el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and married. She has 3 children: the oldest is 17 years old, the middle child is 11 years old, and the youngest is 8 years old. They are all currently studying. María lives in the countryside and she says that she earns her income through keeping livestock, and that her husband makes a living with his team of ox. 

María keeps cows, and the money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of another cow. She covers the household expenses and pays for the education of her children through the sale of her cows' milk. She hopes to continue working for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Sonunbu

texts.ru: Сонунбу, 60 лет, замужем, образование среднее. Примерно 19 лет назад она начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве Сонунбу есть 2 коровы, 22 овцы. На ежедневной основе она продает молоко. Домашнее и экологически чистое оно пользуется большим спросом. На 2,80 Га земли Сонунбу выращивает фасоль для реализации. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях развития своего дела, Сонунбу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян и топлива для обработки почвы, также корову для реализации молока. Сонунбу намерена развить ее бизнес, подготовить трактор к весенне-полевым работам.
texts.en: Sonunbu is 60 years old, married, and she has a secondary education.  About 19 years ago, she became involved in animal husbandry and crop farming.  She has two cows and 22 sheep on her farm.  She sells milk on a daily basis.  She receives a high demand for her farm-produced organic milk.  She also grows beans for resale on 2.8 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 20,000 som (KGS) from her entire activity.  In order to further grow her business, Sonunbu has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 130,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and fuel for land cultivation.  She will also buy a cow to sell more milk.  Sonunbu intends to expand her business and to prepare her tractor for spring field work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel and fertilizers for land cultivation, as well as one dairy cow in order to sell more organic milk.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik lives with her son in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Her  son works seasonally for the  Russian Federation  abroad to provide his mother with good living conditions. When he returns, they are farmers. 

Shushanik has worked since 1979  at the city’s hospital as a nurse. Shushanik is worried because she has some health problems. Shushanik will use the loan to solve her health problems.

loans.use: to solve her health problems

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is a framer who lives with his family in the city of Sevan in Gegharkunik region. Vladimir is 57 years old. He has a daughter (she works at the beauty salon) and his son is at the army. He used to work as a welder at different factories in his city, but started farming in 2005. He has 2 cows, 2 calves, 2 bulls and a lot of chickens. Vladimir’s wife is employed as a saleswoman and helps her husband with the farm. They sell  milk, macun (national dairy-product), meat, and eggs. 

Vladimir wants to enlarge his farm and use the loan to buy one cow and feed. He and his family will be greatly pleased if Kiva lenders decide to help them.

loans.use: to buy one cow and feed.

loans.name: Jivan

texts.en:
Jivan is 48 years old and he lives with his beloved wife in the village of Lchashen  which is in Gegharkunik region. Jivan has farmed all his life and  he has cows, calves, and chickens. He sells milk and eggs. His wife makes cheese and butter to sell. 

Jivan’s wife works at the kindergarden. Jivan rents his land and therefore earns less profit.   He will use the loan to increase his income and buy cows.

loans.use: to buy two more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia es una mujer de cuarenta y nueve años de edad, está unido con su esposo con el que tiene cinco hijos de las edades entre once y diecinueve años, viven en una comunidad denominada san Antonio Suchitepéquez.
Rosalia para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se dedica  a lavar ropa con los vecinos  pero también  vende pollo criollos criados en su propia casa, ella es una mujer que busca la forma de cómo obtener sus ingresos es por esto que cuando es época de lluvia cultiva chipilín, frijol y yuca  con estas actividades mantiene a su familia.
Rosalia ahora ha visto la necesidad de la familia que es necesario la construcción de un dormitorio para sus hijos, pero ella  no cuenta con el dinero suficiente es por ello que solicita un crédito que lo utilizara para comprar materiales de construcción tales como cemento, bloc, arena y hierro.
El gran sueño de Rosalia es seguir prosperando con sus hijos, y contar con una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a forty nine year old woman. She is close with her husband with whom she has five children between the ages of 11 and 19 years old. She lives in a community named San Antonio Suchitepéquez. 

Rosalia, to obtain income and help her husband with the household costs, works washing clothes with the neighbors but also sells native chickens raised at her own home. She is a woman who searches out how to obtain her income and that is why when it is the rainy season she cultivates chipilín (a leafy green), beans and cassava. She maintains her family with these businesses. 

Rosalia has now seen the family’s need and it is necessary to build a bedroom for her children but she does not have enough money. That is why she requests a loan that she will use to buy building materials such as cement, brick, sand and iron.

Rosalia’s greatest dream is to continue thriving with her children and to have a store in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, brick, sand and iron to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es una señora de cuarenta y cinco años de edad, está unida con su esposo con el que tiene una hija que ya se encuentra casada, vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Paulina para obtener sus ingresos  y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se dedica  a la crianza de cerdos en el lugar de su domicilio tiene cuatro años de realizar esta labor, pero para poder mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica  a la compra y venta de cortes típicos de su región.

Paulina con el afán de seguir superando y ofrecerle al cliente los mejores cerdos de la región, ha decidido construir un mejor corral para que los cerdos tengan un lugar más adecuado donde puedan estar, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es no contar con el dinero suficiente para comprar sus materiales, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá para comprar laminas, mayas, tendales  y clavos.
El gran sueño de Paulina es que lo que ahora tiene como corral se convierta en una granja de cerdos muy reconocido.
texts.en:
Paulina is a 45-year-old woman. She is married and has a daughter who is married. Paulina lives in the community of Suchitepéquez.

In order to generate income and help her husband with the home expenses, Paulina works raising pigs at home. She has been doing this for four years. She receives an additional income from buying and selling traditional regional clothes.

Paulina has a strong will to get ahead and wants to offer her customers the best pigs in the region. She decided to improve her pen so that the pigs can have a better place where to live. However, one of the obstacles she faces is the lack of money to buy materials. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy metal sheets, mesh, a canopy and nails.

Her biggest dream is to turn what is now just a pen into a well-known pig farm.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, mesh, a canopy and nails for her pig pen.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is 54 years old and  lives with her husband and parents-in-law who are pensioners, in the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region. Her single son is in the army. She married very early and agricultural is a way of her life. This is her full-time occupation.  She is always busy with farm work, it helps her to think less often of her son, whom she misses so much. She raises cows, calves, sheep and chickens. Arevik’s husband works as a warden at nights at the school; during the day he  help his wife with the farm  They grow potatoes, carrots, cucumbers, and tomato. She sells milk, meat, and eggs at the city wholesale market during the week. 

She will use the loan to purchase potato seedlings, fertilizer, and fodder.

loans.use: to purchase of potato seedlings and fertilizer, and feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Dorin

texts.en:
Dorin is a young man of 24 years old. He lives with his family in a village located in the north of Moldova. After graduating from a professional school, and with no opportunity to continue his studies at university. He looked to working abroad, away from his family, sometimes not receiving the promised wages. This motivated him to return home and help out with the family business. The family works three hectares of arable land, 1 ha is rented, with 2 ha of private property. This year, Dorin’s parents gave him about 0.50 ha of arable land to work with. He immediately decided to plant an orchard of fruit trees, mostly apricot varieties. He will use the money to buy seedlings of fruit trees, to prepare the land for plowing and planting then to pay someone to help with the work.

He has studied the market requirements, if he is able to make it work then it will be a profitable business. He found that there is little competition within Moldova. The land is good and with the apricot harvest he will be able to start bringing in an income. Depending on the season, he may be able to offer some people from the area the possibility of a job.

loans.use: to buy seedlings of fruit trees

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik lives with his family in the village Geghamavan of Gegharkunik region. Andarnik has been employed at different workshops and factories for many years.  He is now a full-time farmer. Andranik and his wife  do their best to earn  their  living.   They have two young children and numerous needs for them. 

Andranik has cows, a heifer, sheep, and chickens. His wife sells milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, and eggs. Andranik sells beef and mutton in the city. The sale of potato, cucumber, tomatoes, and greens provides additional income for them. Andranik would like to enlarge his farm and increase his income.

Andranik will  buy a calf and fodder. He and his family thank the lenders in advance and they will be greatly happy if their farm improvements will be realized with the help of Kiva lenders’ support.

loans.use: to buy a calf and fodder.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik lives with his wife in the town of Vanadzor. Their only son serves in the army. 
Edik has been working in construction for 20 years.   He receives renovation orders from local people in Vanadzor. 
Edik has applied for this loan to purchase construction materials which he needs to complete his current orders. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Edik hopes to receive lenders' support to continue his construction business and earn income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario de 59 años de edad se dedica a la venta de refrescos y bebidas; en el año 2013, con sus ahorros provenientes de la ciudad de Bogotá, comenzó a vender gaseosas y cervezas en la casa propiedad de su hija, con quien aún vive. A Rosario le empezó a ir muy bien con su negocio y hoy sus metas de crecimiento no se detiene, por eso quiere adicionar otros artículos a su oferta aprovechando la clientela cautiva con la que cuenta actualmente.  Rosario realiza sus ventas de contado, así como sus compras y su mercado está concentrado entre sus vecinos, a quienes debe responder de acuerdo a las necesidades sentidas y expresadas por ellos mismos. En la actualidad su mercado ha solicitado mercancías variadas, como ropa, accesorios femeninos, perfumería etc, y está decidida a responder a esta demanda, razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará lo solicitado por la clientela actual con la proyección de generar solicitudes potenciales de nuevos clientes y refrescos en general. Con esta inversión incrementará su capital de trabajo y su oferta se diversificará, a partir del aprovechamiento de sus clientes reales, lo cual hace que su microcrédito sea exitoso.
texts.en:
Rosario, 59, sells beverages. She had saved some money while living in Bogotá, and in 2013 started to sell sodas and beer at her daughter’s home, which is where she lives now. Rosario’s business is thriving, and she does not plan to stop growing. This is why she wants to offer more products, taking advantage of her current customer base.

Rosario sells on cash. She plans her purchases based on what her neighbors demand. They are demanding different things, such as clothes, accessories for women, and perfumes. She wants to fulfill these demands, which is why she is requesting a Credikiva at Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the first time.

With this loan she will buy the products that her customers are demanding, with the additional intention of attracting new customers and increase her beverages sales. This investment will help her to increase her working capital and diversify her products, and she will be able to better serve her customers. This will prove that taking a microloan was a good decision.

loans.use: to buy beverages, clothes, accessories for women, and perfumes.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel lives with her beloved wife in the village of  Tsaghkunk of Gegharkunik region. For several years, he worked at the poultry factory, but now with his wife he is a farmer. He breeds cows, calves, a heifer, sheep, and chickens. He sells milk, meat, and eggs.  They grow potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, and greens to earn the family's living.  

Their single son is now in Russian Federation and sends money to his parents. Samvel mentions that he dreams of the day that he will be finally back from abroad, get married, and continue to develop the farm that Samvel established for him. 

Samvel has a an for a new source of income which can also be used for his farm.  He wants to buy a track of land to manage orders of cargo transfers in his region.

loans.use: to buy a track of land.

loans.name: Rudik

texts.en:
Rudik was born in the village of Ddmashenf in the Gegharkunik region. He happily lives here with his wife and son. Rudik’s son is 22 years old and he is in construction. 

Rudik  worked for 20 years at the horse breeding business as a coach and horse keeper. He is now a full-time farmer. He raises cows, bulls, sheep, pigs, and chickens. He  sells beef, mutton, pork, and  poultry. Rudik’s wife sells  milk, cheese, and eggs to their neighbors and customers from the city. They also grow potatoes, cabbage, peppers, cucumber, tomatoes, and greens. This harvest is  sold at the city’s wholesale market. 

 Rudik wants to buy potato seedlings and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fodder .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the roof.

loans.name: Javahir

texts.en:
Javahir is 36 years old and  lives in the city of Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. She is a mother of 4 young children. Jahavir has had a  business for 5 years to sell fruit and vegetables. 

Her husband greatly helps her when it is time to bring new and fresh products for their market. In her market Javahir sells a great assortment of vegetables and fruits such as greens, onions, garlic, carrots, peppers, potato, cabbages, cucumbers, and tomatoes. She sells oranges, bananas, kiwis, pears, peaches, and apple. Javahir cares for her customers, and she offers them good prices and polite service. Her business helps  to cover their numerous needs of her big family.
 
Javahir will use the loan to restock her  fruits and vegetables and make it more attractive for her customers.

loans.use: to refresh her market’s assortment of both with fruits and vegetables and make it more attractive for her customers.

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Sada, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children; one of them is still small and the other one is still in school.  She has been running two projects, selling charcoal and a genge for two years now.  She works from 07am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Sada's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase the genge duka (a retail shop providing fruits and vegetables in the same shop). She dreams of opening a shop for selling clothes.

Sada will share this loan with her loan group, "Sarange", which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase on the genge duka.

loans.name: Los Tres Pinos Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario los Tres Pinos lo integran tres mujeres emprendedoras que solicitan por vigésima quinta ocasión el financiamiento en ADIM para sus negocios, quien lo coordina es la señora María que tiene la edad de 37 años, casada y madre de tres hijos de las edades de 19, 15 y 8 años de los cuales solamente los menores dependen económicamente de ella, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado invertir más en su negocio y de las ganancias obtenidas realizar mejoras a su vivienda y la compra de electrodomésticos, esto la ha motivado a seguir solicitando los financiamientos en ADIM, esta vez invertirá en camisetas, blusas, camisolas, camisolines, talladores, pantalones, etc. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras, Rosa que tiene la edad de 33 años y se dedica a la venta de verduras en su domicilio desde hace veintiún años, y Margarita de 50 años de edad y se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas, además realiza cultivos en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Tres Pinos is comprised of three entrepreneurial women who are requesting a loan from ADIM for their businesses, for the 25th time. The group’s coordinator is María, who is 37 years old, married, and has three children aged 19, 15, and 8. The youngest ones depend on her.

With the previous loans she was able to invest in her business, and with the profits, she made some home improvements and bought electric appliances. This has motivated her to continue requesting loans from ADIM. This time she will buy shirts, blouses, camisoles, bras, pants, etc.

The remaining members are Rosa, who is 33 and has been selling vegetables at home for twenty-one years, and Margarita, who is 50 and buys and sells vegetables (she grows some of them at home).

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, camisoles, bras, pants, etc.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is a farmer from Geghakert village of the Armavir region. She lives with her husband. 

With the help of her husband, Ruzanna is extensively engaged in agribusiness, which is the main source of the family's income. They cultivate haricot, cabbage, and grow strawberries.  Ruzanna's husband sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

Ruzanna and her husband work hard to be able to cover the increasing needs of their family. As life is getting more expensive day by day, Ruzanna wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit to be able to meet the daily costs of the family more effectively. 

She needs a loan to purchase cabbage seeds and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. As this is Ruzanna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

She and her husband will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for cabbage seeds and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse to prepare the farm for the new cultivation season and to earn income for the family's living

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is an experienced farmer from Haytagh village of the Armavir region. She lives with her husband and 15-year-old daughter. 

To be able to meet her family's needs, Narine is engaged in the cultivation of potatoes, tomatoes and greens. Narine's husband helps her greatly in her everyday farming activities; he brings the agricultural products to the local market. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Narine needs a loan to purchase  potato seeds, fertilizer for land cultivation and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse to improve the farm and be prepared for the new cultivation season. 

As this is Narine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first chance loan program provides loans to people who haven't had access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. 

Narine and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer for land cultivation and a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse to improve the farm and be prepared for the new cultivation season

loans.name: Zhenya

texts.en:
Zhenya lives in Arshaluys village of the Armavir region with her husband and two sons. Her elder son serves in the army and other two help her with farming activities.

Zhenya takes care of the arable land where the family cultivates potatoes, haricots, cabbages and greens. Income from agriculture is very important for the family's living, and that's the reason Zhenya and her whole family work really hard to be able to sustain their living. 

By applying for this loan, Zhenya asks for financial support from Kiva lenders to be able to support her farm in purchasing potato and cabbage seeds, and hire workers for cultivation work to develop the farm and make it more productive. 

Zhenya has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful, and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan. Zhenya has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for potato and cabbage seeds, and hire workers for cultivation work to develop the farm and make it more productive

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en:
Sirvard lives in Marmashen village of the Shirak region with her husband and two sons, who are construction workers. Sirvard and her husband are occupied in agriculture. Their farm includes livestock of cows, calves and hens, and they cultivate wheat, potatoes and grass. Sirvard also takes care of a small orchard near their house, where walnuts and apples are grown. 

Srivard asks for this loan to develop their farm and make it profitable so the family will have means for covering basic needs. Her loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to access markets and earn a living.

Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs are a number of the difficulties for people to develop their business in the Shirak region.

All Sirvard needs is some financial resources to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer needed for land cultivation.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer needed for land cultivation to make farming business profitable and cover family's basic needs

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
The sunny woman in the photo is Melanya from Jajur village of the Shirak region. She lives there with her husband and son, who is not married and lives with his parents and helps them with farming. 

Melanya's farm includes livestock of cow, calves and hens, as well as the cultivation of wheat and potatoes, which Melanya's husband sells in the local market. 

To be able to boost her farm's productivity, Melanya asks lenders for support. She applies for this loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer needed for the development of the farm.

Melanya's loan has been approved through the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, to help them to gain market access and earn a living. 

Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs create a number of difficulties for people to develop their businesses in the Shirak region. 

Melanya thanks her Kiva lenders in advance, and she anticipates their support.
